commit_message:
Move the code to create the ansible symlink.

Mpve the code in the __new__ special method it's more clean. Add a
warning user can't create the symlink.

Change-Id: I3ef7eb567cd6989dd96f6df719b0d2ffeb3f378a
Closes-bug: #1816446

commit_message:
Add service template sections walkthough (part 3)

This adds some of the sections from the service template that are
container-related:

* puppet_config
* kolla_config
* docker_config
* docker_puppet_tasks

More patches are coming to describe the rest of the parameters.

Change-Id: Ib478748b50ab94d7e06fefc5a7247fb633423c09
Related-Bug: #1804642

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 16:29:56.000000000', 'message': "functional: Do not inherit from SqlTestCaseLight

Inheriting from SqlTestCaseLight in some tests and from
SqlTestCase in some others at the same time may cause errors
in functional tests. According to comments in SqlTestCaseLight
implementation in Neutron, that's intended for unit tests
only. This patch is changing it so that all tests inherit
from the same Sql Base class.

For a long time, we've been hitting failures in gate due to
race conditions in functional tests caused by this issue.

Change-Id: Id9c917f604024f6c82b1ff638ba58bce1f2b306b
Closes-Bug: #1808146
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 649c7d7af9a23da46b44db344ad16b1b186ef3ca)
"}]
commit_message:
functional: Do not inherit from SqlTestCaseLight

Inheriting from SqlTestCaseLight in some tests and from
SqlTestCase in some others at the same time may cause errors
in functional tests. According to comments in SqlTestCaseLight
implementation in Neutron, that's intended for unit tests
only. This patch is changing it so that all tests inherit
from the same Sql Base class.

For a long time, we've been hitting failures in gate due to
race conditions in functional tests caused by this issue.

Change-Id: Id9c917f604024f6c82b1ff638ba58bce1f2b306b
Closes-Bug: #1808146
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 649c7d7af9a23da46b44db344ad16b1b186ef3ca)

commit_message:
WIP: Add upper-constraints file

with the combination usage of `-c` and `-r`, pip prefer to install
the version written in constraints file (i.e. -c) even the requirements
file want to install lower version than the constraint. Then the
installed version will be conflicted with the requirments.
(It seems like a bug in pip, tho?)

Anyway, this patch attempts to overwrite the constraint with minimal
change from the openstack global requirements and to keep following the
constraint as possible.

Change-Id: I1a1bb8a83217b6f093ff7d1dba444a9c17572a5c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 03:48:34.000000000', 'message': 'Correct fernet token sync race condition

The fernet token rotation is subject to a race condition when using
aggressive rotation in a high volume, high traffic, high capacity cloud.
This change addresses the potential race condition by converting our
fernet token sync method from rsync to scp and by sorting the fernet
keys in reverse version ordering. This will ensure that the key with
the highest index is always synchronized first and will ensure that
the underlying file structure of a given target node always remains
intact during a sync operation.

Relates-To: bug/1816927

Change-Id: I9087d953f7dabe04a2ad19af6121dae71544e5b2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Correct fernet token sync race condition

The fernet token rotation is subject to a race condition when using
aggressive rotation in a high volume, high traffic, high capacity cloud.
This change addresses the potential race condition by converting our
fernet token sync method from rsync to scp and by sorting the fernet
keys in reverse version ordering. This will ensure that the key with
the highest index is always synchronized first and will ensure that
the underlying file structure of a given target node always remains
intact during a sync operation.

Related-Bug: 1816927
Change-Id: I9087d953f7dabe04a2ad19af6121dae71544e5b2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Add fedora support to tripleo-repos

Deprecate --centos-mirror in favour of more generic parameter --mirror
but respects it for backwards compatibility.

Enable fedora mirrors to be configured with --mirror parameter.

Assures that default distro specific mirrors are using the distro
parameter.

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/733
Change-Id: I0c8852a0524b6460b4219d0e91c0f43444905a1f
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-19 04:28:44.000000000', 'message': "Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: I41152e56e36b62094ea56e794f16333c4074e7c4
"}]
commit_message:
Use renamed template 'integrated-gate-py3'

'integrated-gate-py35' template is going to be
renamed to 'integrated-gate-py3' in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/

Integrated jobs are running on Bionic now where python 3.6 is available.
Which means gate jobs in 'integrated-gate-py35' template are
running on python 3.6 not on 3.5 which makes this template name confusing.

depends on commit rename the 'integrated-gate-py35' to 'integrated-gate-py3'
so that it can convey that template will use available python 3 version
in used distro. For example: 3.5 in xenial and 3.6 in bionic and so on.

This commit starts using the new template name so that old
template name can be removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626078/
Change-Id: I41152e56e36b62094ea56e794f16333c4074e7c4

commit_message:
Prevent leases from being deleted during event execution

A user can request to delete a lease while it is changing state via
event execution, which can trigger an error condition as on_end will
attempt to delete the corresponding aggregate.

This commit prevents a lease from being deleted while its start_lease or
end_lease events are in progress.

Change-Id: I73bde0219b6ea30d16564fd2507fd59d52cbfa6a
Closes-Bug: #1791741

[{'created': '2017-03-14 11:18:23.000000000', 'message': 'conf: Improve documentation for defer_iptables_apply

The help text for this option is improved based on information I found
while researching the option and mostly taken from the commit message
for commit 8f1c54ce.

This option may be deprecated in the near future but cannot be quite
yet. A note is added to this effect.

Change-Id: I33607453b3174192a33d9d56e203227bc9237f31

'}, {'created': '2019-02-25 15:54:43.000000000', 'message': "conf: Deprecated 'defer_iptables_apply'

This is *mostly* used for nova-network and therefore can be deprecated.
There is one corner case where we could conceivably use this with
neutron and the libvirt driver, but it's only ever going to work with
with Linux bridge, is probably broken and should just be removed in
favour of neutron variants of this functionality. A note is included
detailing this, just in case people do want to spend the time getting to
the bottom of this, but I wouldn't recommend that.

The help text for this option is improved based on information I found
while researching the option and mostly taken from the commit message
for commit 8f1c54ce.

Change-Id: I33607453b3174192a33d9d56e203227bc9237f31
"}]
commit_message:
conf: Deprecated 'defer_iptables_apply'

This is *mostly* used for nova-network and therefore can be deprecated.
There is one corner case where we could conceivably use this with
neutron and the libvirt driver, but it's only ever going to work with
with Linux bridge, is probably broken and should just be removed in
favour of neutron variants of this functionality. A note is included
detailing this, just in case people do want to spend the time getting to
the bottom of this, but I wouldn't recommend that.

The help text for this option is improved based on information I found
while researching the option and mostly taken from the commit message
for commit 8f1c54ce.

Change-Id: I33607453b3174192a33d9d56e203227bc9237f31

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 15:59:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add unit tests for missing VirtualInterface in 2.70 os-interface

This adds some simple unit tests for showing and listing attached
port interfaces where the corresponding VirtualInterface record
does not exist - which is possible for very old port attachments
since we started creating the VirtualInterface record for neutron
ports in the Newton release.

This is a follow up to I09420ff7134874dfe4dc399931c7740e81ecc2d0.

Part of blueprint expose-virtual-device-tags-in-rest-api

Change-Id: If14c4d6e97870de875b5dcd6bf68bd1b56ffad74
'}]
commit_message:
Add unit tests for missing VirtualInterface in 2.70 os-interface

This adds some simple unit tests for showing and listing attached
port interfaces where the corresponding VirtualInterface record
does not exist - which is possible for very old port attachments
since we started creating the VirtualInterface record for neutron
ports in the Newton release.

This is a follow up to I09420ff7134874dfe4dc399931c7740e81ecc2d0.

Part of blueprint expose-virtual-device-tags-in-rest-api

Change-Id: If14c4d6e97870de875b5dcd6bf68bd1b56ffad74

commit_message:
Allow tripleo-admin user to have a keypair

By setting tripleo_admin_generate_key:true, the user will have
a keypair created for it, and the public key is added to the
authorized_keys file for that user.

This allows the private key file to be injected elsewhere for other
users to access this user.

Specifically, this private key will be made available to the
mistral-executor container so that it can ssh out into the
tripleo-admin user on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I6ec5a01e736aeb00fcad1e589211c6a8a8aeecef

> With this change, undercloud prepare is taking 9.5 minutes vs 37

+1 for the performance improvement, @stevebaker i looked some job for time taken(looked /var/log/tripleo-container-image-prepare.log), i found with this patch it's around 9 minutes , without patch it's around 14-15 minutes. May be i looked wrong or may be where you have seen 37 minutes something is wrong there.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 03:36:44.000000000', 'message': 'Speed up execution time of yum_update.sh

Doing a yum update with an explicit list of packages where many of
those packages are already up-to-date has a significant time penalty.
This change includes version comparison to remove packages from
packages_for_update where the installed and available versions are
identical.

This change also only installs yum-plugin-priorities if it is not
already installed, for some extra time saving.

For a specific example of time saved, I had a
centos-binary-rsyslog-base with the following timings.

Without this change
-------------------
packages passed to yum update: 87
packages actually updated:     11
time taken                     35s

With this change
-------------------
packages passed to yum update: 11
packages actually updated:     11
time taken                     10s

This time saved should add up over all of the container images during
image prepare in CI.

Change-Id: Ie282acd1cdc0de8d875959ec9578122fe34f98ac

commit_message:
Speed up execution time of yum_update.sh

Doing a yum update with an explicit list of packages where many of
those packages are already up-to-date has a significant time penalty.
This change includes version comparison to remove packages from
packages_for_update where the installed and available versions are
identical.

This change also only installs yum-plugin-priorities if it is not
already installed, for some extra time saving.

For a specific example of time saved, I had a
centos-binary-rsyslog-base with the following timings.

Without this change
-------------------
packages passed to yum update: 87
packages actually updated:     11
time taken                     35s

With this change
-------------------
packages passed to yum update: 11
packages actually updated:     11
time taken                     10s

This time saved should add up over all of the container images during
image prepare in CI.

Change-Id: Ie282acd1cdc0de8d875959ec9578122fe34f98ac

commit_message:
Update service policies for system admin

The service policies were not taking the default roles work we did
last release into account. This commit changes the default policies
to rely on the ``admin`` role to create and delete services.
Subsequent patches will incorporate:

 - domain user test coverage
 - project user test coverage

Change-Id: I58bbe6848c9e8e63656a6c706c84d1747c72a71e
Related-Bug: 1804462
Closes-Bug: 1804463

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and zunclient use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/python-zunclient/search?q=jsonutils&unscoped_q=jsonutils

header.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 07:17:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix parsing api version with correct service_type

Masakari project service_type is `instance-ha` but it reads
the api_version from `OpenStack-API-Version` request header
using service_type `masakari`.

This patch fixes this issue by changing service_type from
`masakari` to `instance-ha`.

Closes-Bug: #1816941
Change-Id: Ife141f9eab438e21f02966f3d27a6f044d4aa4ac
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parsing api version with correct service_type

Masakari project service_type is `instance-ha` but it reads
the api_version from `OpenStack-API-Version` request header
using service_type `masakari`.

This patch fixes this issue by changing service_type from
`masakari` to `instance-ha`.

Closes-Bug: #1816941
Change-Id: Ife141f9eab438e21f02966f3d27a6f044d4aa4ac

commit_message:
Add progress details for recovery workflow

Taskflow supports persistence of task which helps to persist each
task details in the database. Using this functionality, Masakari
will store task details for recovery failures.

Change-Id: I4fe394f473a93aedc9e167bbde3dd196cfc89559
Implements: bp progress-details-recovery-workflows

commit_message:
Add event notification feature to masakari

Typical openstack services have event notification feature[1].
This spec adds the such feature for masakari.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/notifications.html

Change-Id: I4fc551d82fa0a0531676cfd7fbc787c493e2839b
Implements: bp notifications-in-masakari

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-19 20:14:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This tricky part of this is dealing with the code that curently manages re-parenting or un-parenting as well as some tests which make sure that root provider cannot be set.

The root stuff we can probably manage by not using it in constructors: we tend to set roots after construction.

However the parent handling is entwined with the 'updates' idea in OVO: these fields have changed from what they were before.

I could use some help on this. Not simply because I'm stuck, but always because I think I've got myself into a mental corner where I've lost sight of the actual purpose of this stuff."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-20 09:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2019-02-21 13:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 01:24:07.000000000', 'message': "Don't use OVO with ResourceProvider and ResourceProviderList

Left the most challenging to last, when I'm too tired to
resolve stuff. There's quite a bit of clean up that will
need to happen.

There is one major flaw in this that needs to be fixed:

* The handling of SETTABLE_FIELDS is turned off. The
  implementation relied on being aware of what changed
  in an object, via OVO. We haven't got that, so need
  a different approach. Which should be fine, but I
  couldn't do it now.

* There were two deepcopy calls in the allocation request
  handling. When using OVO the __deepcopy__ handling
  built into it prevents deep recursion. I change them
  to copy and things still work but I'm not sure it is
  okay. I have them marked for a conversation with
  efried because after midnight is no time to tease out
  that code.

Other things to note:

* As with the other changes, where context is actually used
  by the object is is required in the constructor. This
  cascades some changes to tests.

* I got very lazy where that context needed to be mocked
  in a few places, just wanting to move forward. It can
  be cleaned up.

* A test that checks to see if adding traits resets the
  changes on a rp has been removed, because we don't
  track that any more if we haven't got OVO.

oslo.versionedobjects is removed from requirements. This
doesn't have a huge impact on the size of the virtualenv:
114M -> 107M [1] but it does take us from 132 python
dependencies (via pip list) to 119, removing plenty of
stuff that was only being called in because stuff that
we don't used depended on it.

[1] Of note, 26M of that is babel. Do we need to translate
exceptions?

Change-Id: Ie0a9351e0d7c762c9c96c45cbe50132a0fbd1486

Turn ResourceProvider and ResourceProviderList into
classical Python objects.

There is one major flaw in this that needs to be fixed and
a significant change that needs to be thought about:

* The handling of SETTABLE_FIELDS is turned off. The
  implementation relied on being aware of what changed
  in an object, via OVO. We haven't got that, so need
  a different approach.

  Some tests associated with this are currently failing,
  guarding us until we determine a fix.

* There were two deepcopy calls in the allocation request
  handling. When using OVO the __deepcopy__ handling
  built into it prevents deep recursion. I change them
  to copy and things still work but I'm not sure it is
  okay. I have them marked for a conversation with
  efried. No test seems to care whether a copy or
  deepcopy is being used. Further investigation required.

Other things to note:

* As with the other changes, where context is actually used
  by the object is is required in the constructor. This
  cascades some changes to tests.

* A test that checks to see if adding traits resets the
  changes on a rp has been removed, because we don't
  track that any more if we haven't got OVO.

"}, {'created': '2019-02-21 16:11:44.000000000', 'message': "Don't use OVO with ResourceProvider and ResourceProviderList

Turn ResourceProvider and ResourceProviderList into
classical Python objects.

There are two changes here which deserve particular
attention because they are more changing than the other
OVO removals:

* There were two deepcopy calls in the allocation request
  handling. When using OVO, the __deepcopy__ handling
  built into it prevents deep recursion. I changed them
  to copy and things still work as expected. This will
  be because using the nested objects by reference is
  acceptable.

* The removal of OVO removes the detection of changed fields.
  This was being used when creating and saving resource
  providers (at the object level) to automagically detect
  and prevent writing fields we don't want to.

  This change removes that functionality. Instead if bad
  data has made it as far as the create or save calls, we
  simply don't write it. The HTTP layer continues to
  maintain the guards it already had in place to prevent
  badness. Tests which were testing the object layer
  are removed.

  The create_provider function in functional/db/test_base
  allowed (trying to) create a provider with a root
  but that functionality was only called from one place.
  That place and the functionality in create_provider
  is removed.

Other things to note:

* As with the other changes, where context is actually used
  by the object it is required in the constructor. This
  cascades some changes to tests.

* A test that checks to see if adding traits resets the
  changes on a rp has been removed, because we don't
  track that any more if we haven't got OVO.

oslo.versionedobjects is removed from requirements. This
doesn't have a huge impact on the size of the virtualenv:
114M -> 107M [1] but it does take us from 132 python
dependencies (via pip list) to 119, removing plenty of
stuff that was only being called in because stuff that
we don't use depended on it.

lower-constraints.txt is updated to reflect the removal
of dependencies that are no longer needed.

[1] Of note, 26M of that is babel. Do we need to translate
exceptions?

Change-Id: Ie0a9351e0d7c762c9c96c45cbe50132a0fbd1486

commit_message:
Don't use OVO with ResourceProvider and ResourceProviderList

Turn ResourceProvider and ResourceProviderList into
classical Python objects.

There are two changes here which deserve particular
attention because they are more changing than the other
OVO removals:

* There were two deepcopy calls in the allocation request
  handling. When using OVO, the __deepcopy__ handling
  built into it prevents deep recursion. I changed them
  to copy and things still work as expected. This will
  be because using the nested objects by reference is
  acceptable.

* The removal of OVO removes the detection of changed fields.
  This was being used when creating and saving resource
  providers (at the object level) to automagically detect
  and prevent writing fields we don't want to.

  This change removes that functionality. Instead if bad
  data has made it as far as the create or save calls, we
  simply don't write it. The HTTP layer continues to
  maintain the guards it already had in place to prevent
  badness. Tests which were testing the object layer
  are removed.

  The create_provider function in functional/db/test_base
  allowed (trying to) create a provider with a root
  but that functionality was only called from one place.
  That place and the functionality in create_provider
  is removed.

Other things to note:

* As with the other changes, where context is actually used
  by the object it is required in the constructor. This
  cascades some changes to tests.

* A test that checks to see if adding traits resets the
  changes on a rp has been removed, because we don't
  track that any more if we haven't got OVO.

* The last_modified handling in placement/util no longer
  need NotImplemented handling, that was an artifact of
  OVO.

oslo.versionedobjects is removed from requirements. This
doesn't have a huge impact on the size of the virtualenv:
114M -> 107M [1] but it does take us from 132 python
dependencies (via pip list) to 119, removing plenty of
stuff that was only being called in because stuff that
we don't use depended on it.

lower-constraints.txt is updated to reflect the removal
of dependencies that are no longer needed.

[1] Of note, 26M of that is babel. Do we need to translate
exceptions? See email disussion at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/thread.html#3002

Change-Id: Ie0a9351e0d7c762c9c96c45cbe50132a0fbd1486

commit_message:
docs: Add os-migrate_volume_completion api-ref

This admin API is only called externally by Nova at present when
finishing the migration or retype of an attached volume. However for
future reference it would be really useful to have this listed in the
official API reference guide.

Change-Id: I5fad6eb4903784870aa26fa0996a391bbbbb9276

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-01 02:29:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add method to allow fetch root_volume BDM by instance_uuid

In order to support attach/detach root volume, we need to
be able to fetch root BDM record of an instance from DB.
We will then use this record to update related fields in
the attach workflow.

According to the design, we will have to null-out some of
fields when we perform detach workflow, this patch also
addresses that.

Change-Id: I7cdb79003b89ac400b169272f77eafdf210b3d17
Implements: blueprint detach-root-volume
'}, {'created': '2018-11-01 02:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add method to allow fetch root_volume BDM by instance_uuid

In order to support attach/detach root volume, we need to
be able to fetch root BDM record of an instance from DB.
We will then use this record to update related fields in
the attach workflow.

commit_message:
Add method to allow reset fields for root bdm in BDM obj

According to the design of detach/attach root volume,
we will have to null-out some of fields when we
perform detach workflow, this patch also addresses that.

Change-Id: I7cdb79003b89ac400b169272f77eafdf210b3d17
Implements: blueprint detach-boot-volume

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-18 00:04:11.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamic inventory backup corruption fix

When multiple users and process are accessing the dynamic inventory
the inventory backup and json can get corrupted. This change checks
for inventory modifictions and only saves if needed. The backup
is also moved to right before the actual save.

Change-Id: Ifd348ddd9c21526f5b523963dd1fd247edd6b109
Closes-Bug: #1750233
'}]
commit_message:
Dynamic inventory backup corruption fix

When multiple users and process are accessing the dynamic inventory
the inventory backup and json can get corrupted. This change checks
for inventory modifictions and only saves if needed. The backup
is also moved to right before the actual save.

Change-Id: Ifd348ddd9c21526f5b523963dd1fd247edd6b109
Closes-Bug: #1750233

subject: Use validate_legacy
messages: [{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-02-23 22:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2019-02-26 00:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-23 22:18:06.000000000', 'message': 'Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Ib31134bb604e32fd274b41dc78c4356500f71ab0
'}]
commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Ib31134bb604e32fd274b41dc78c4356500f71ab0

commit_message:
Rename errors file if it's big

when renamed it's not sent to logstash and not indexed, which
prevents logstash OOM failures.
Change-Id: I6389f6700a401f494187a283ca8fbc3b69784541

commit_message:
Prepare in_tree allocation candidates

This patch adds a filter of in_tree query for both paths,
_get_trees_matching_all() and _get_provider_ids_matching().

This patch changes _get_providers_with_resource() to filter it using
SQL. An alternative is to leave it simple and filter it out of the
function not using SQL, but we don't take this to get more performance
and note that this doesn't lose the logging capability of existing
aggregate/traits filter used for debugging.

Change-Id: I374b906e8084b6c432a22023154bef0c896767c3
Blueprint: alloc-candidates-in-tree

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 04:25:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix output of interface-attach command

Add output of a result in the 'nova interface-attach'
command when it is successful.
Make the following methods return a 'NetworkInterface'
object instead of a 'Server' object.

* The 'interface_attach' method
  in the 'novaclient.v2.Server' class
* The 'interface_attach' method
  in the 'novaclient.v2.ServerManager' class

Remove unnecessary code in the 'nova interface-detach'
command because the response body is not returned.

Change-Id: Id5316d8ad4a4b67e8399b51e602aafc83bc128c6
Closes-Bug: #1816511
"}]
commit_message:
Fix output of interface-attach command

Add output of a result in the 'nova interface-attach'
command when it is successful.
Make the following methods return a 'NetworkInterface'
object instead of a 'Server' object.

* The 'interface_attach' method
  in the 'novaclient.v2.Server' class
* The 'interface_attach' method
  in the 'novaclient.v2.ServerManager' class

Remove unnecessary code in the 'nova interface-detach'
command because the response body is not returned.

Change-Id: Id5316d8ad4a4b67e8399b51e602aafc83bc128c6
Closes-Bug: #1816511

commit_message:
Rocky: Switch to workflow driven image prepare

This tests container-prepare-workflow and concludes the coding/testing
portion of this blueprint.

Since image prepare happens during overcloud deploy, the role
overcloud-prep-containers is skipped completely from rocky onwards.
The file containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is written out during
undercloud-deploy.

Change-Id: Ibfa2e23b482d743ed04fce5e039096cec3d592df
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Add platform check for xattr and pysendfile

Those modules are not Windows compatible, for which reason we'll
have to use platform checks.

This change is part of the Glance Windows compatibility blueprint.

Change-Id: If63c8ea012991e61b3493bd26178b0956b229488

[{'created': '2019-02-25 16:44:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix functional tests

The commit 185b13f228ac6861f567270cb9fc0bc08260ec09 from core OVN
introduced two new tables called Meter and Meter_Band to the north and
south OVN databases and a new column called "meter" in the ACL table.
These new reference is not being accounted in our tests (when comparing
the ACLs) which is breaking our functional tests. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I2f70a87b7e8422515c592600fa1fbd9fa45ceaa5
(cherry picked from commit 09827e953b1ea75f64097c710c234af819b365d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix functional tests

The commit 185b13f228ac6861f567270cb9fc0bc08260ec09 from core OVN
introduced two new tables called Meter and Meter_Band to the north and
south OVN databases and a new column called "meter" in the ACL table.
These new reference is not being accounted in our tests (when comparing
the ACLs) which is breaking our functional tests. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I2f70a87b7e8422515c592600fa1fbd9fa45ceaa5
(cherry picked from commit 09827e953b1ea75f64097c710c234af819b365d1)

Check Monitor in Member Scenario Tests

Currently the Member scenario tests are not checking
if Monitor is enabled in the Tempest conf or not. This patch adds
the fix.

commit_message:
Define single place for irrelevant-files

We can define single place for irrelevant-files
and use them accross gate and fucntional jobs.

Change-Id: I19fc95ac476a3ff6fa967504668e2a28812a1849

[{'created': '2019-02-14 01:24:07.000000000', 'message': "Don't use OVO for Inventory and InventoryList

There are some more substantial changes here, including a few
things what may need to move earlier in the statck.

The standard stuff: Inventory and InventoryList are now classical
Python objects.

* Neither make use of a self._context, so that is removed, cascading
  changes through some tests. There are other tests (noted in
  a FIXME) for other classes which still use context but should not
  but the test still works because the context is taken as an id
  which is not used[1].

* From early on Inventory used obj_set_defaults to, uh, set defaults.
  Now keyword args in __init__ are handling that.

* However a test which was checking for out of bounds values when
  creating Inventory objects has been removed because it can no
  longer work. I feel this is safe because we have jsonschema
  on the HTTP API and HTTP is the interface.

* Timestamp handling (in placement.util) needs some tweaks to
  do with objects that were never loaded from the database. The
  comments there should indicate what's going on.

There is quite a bit of duplication shared with other *List classes.
That cleanup will come, if we decide this is a way to go.

[1] This is one of the areas where the type checking would have
helped were it still there. But there are other (more in the norm
of Python) ways to approach that if we like. Once the problem
is found and fixed it's pretty just okay.

Change-Id: I1a58810e73010ccefb80967d12f283e0f7007205

commit_message:
Don't use OVO for Inventory and InventoryList

There are some more substantial changes here, including a few
things what may need to move earlier in the statck.

The standard stuff: Inventory and InventoryList are now classical
Python objects.

* Neither make use of a self._context, so that is removed, cascading
  changes through some tests.

* From early on Inventory used obj_set_defaults to, uh, set defaults.
  Now keyword args in __init__ are handling that.

* However a test which was checking for out of bounds values when
  creating Inventory objects has been removed because it can no
  longer work. I feel this is safe because we have jsonschema
  on the HTTP API and HTTP is the interface.

* Timestamp handling (in placement.util) needs some tweaks to
  do with objects that were never loaded from the database. The
  comments there should indicate what's going on.

There is quite a bit of duplication shared with other *List classes.
That cleanup will come.

Change-Id: I1a58810e73010ccefb80967d12f283e0f7007205

commit_message:
Don't use OVO in Trait and TraitList objects

Turn Trait and TraiList into classical python objects.

The changes here are nearly identical to those made to
ResourceClass and ResourceClassList which indicates some
opportunities for less duplicated code.

Some of the duplication is okay, and helps to keep things
explicit, but some of it is extraneous.

Interesting note: there was still a remotable method in here.

Change-Id: I954c6d0a86fc45dc689a2c54a3d34382dfd68bf5

commit_message:
Update the doc in _get_provider_ids_matching()

The note in _get_provider_ids_matching() is now old in the point that
sharing providers can be invovled in a granular request. This patch
updates it according to the notes in _get_trees_matching_all(),
which pairs up with _get_provider_ids_matching().

Change-Id: I7ef6bffd4dc2cf84e16c55a1525fe6f84e94d3a4

messages: [{'account_id': 21714, 'date': '2019-02-20 23:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 21714, 'date': '2019-02-21 15:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-02-22 01:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-02-25 22:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-20 23:07:41.000000000', 'message': 'Dynamic inventory backup corruption fix

When multiple users and process are accessing the dynamic inventory
the inventory backup and json can get corrupted. This change checks
for inventory modifictions and only saves if needed. The backup
is also moved to right before the actual save.

Change-Id: Ifd348ddd9c21526f5b523963dd1fd247edd6b109
Closes-Bug: #1750233
'}]
commit_message:
Dynamic inventory backup corruption fix

When multiple users and process are accessing the dynamic inventory
the inventory backup and json can get corrupted. This change checks
for inventory modifictions and only saves if needed. The backup
is also moved to right before the actual save.

Change-Id: Ifd348ddd9c21526f5b523963dd1fd247edd6b109
Closes-Bug: #1750233

commit_message:
Dynamic inventory backup corruption fix

When multiple users and process are accessing the dynamic inventory
the inventory backup and json can get corrupted. This change checks
for inventory modifictions and only saves if needed. The backup
is also moved to right before the actual save.

Change-Id: Ifd348ddd9c21526f5b523963dd1fd247edd6b109
Closes-Bug: #1750233

commit_message:
rehome trunk service constants

While [1] rehomed trunk callback resource names, this patch rehomes
the trunk service constants. These constants are used throughout our
consumer base [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635209/
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=from%20neutron.services.trunk%20import%20constants

Change-Id: I20ed69ba823d81220650bb8f34514121fe4399d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-21 20:45:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove "when failed" from debug task names

This commit removes the "when failed" from the task title to eliminate
confusion.

These tasks always run to show the debug output for the previous task,
regardless of whether the the previous task failed or not. They will
show the debug output as long as the previous task finished (success or
failure).

Change-Id: I4e52bdc18885f13793550e5032fb1316a13b248c
(cherry picked from commit 13aaf52a468bf020ce74ec34bb38ce8c8a908788)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove "when failed" from debug task names

This commit removes the "when failed" from the task title to eliminate
confusion.

These tasks always run to show the debug output for the previous task,
regardless of whether the the previous task failed or not. They will
show the debug output as long as the previous task finished (success or
failure).

Change-Id: I4e52bdc18885f13793550e5032fb1316a13b248c
(cherry picked from commit 13aaf52a468bf020ce74ec34bb38ce8c8a908788)

commit_message:
step4: flatten nova service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration.

Change-Id: I9bd5c9f007d9f69d7310cdd0106bcc923c1b0acd

commit_message:
Replace ntp with chrony

Chrony is the new default timesync service, but we still were installing
ntp by default. Let's replace the ntp package install with an explicit
chrony install.

Change-Id: Ib6494c6d2745d3573365eca9aae76d677654fbd2
Related-Blueprint: tripleo-chrony

[{'created': '2019-01-30 15:25:14.000000000', 'message': "Test gate job w/ notifications enabled

I don't really want to enable ceilometer,
but I do want to see if this will detect bug #1805790.

If so, rework things to be able to enable
notifications w/o enabling ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ib4c2a24677d673bc84fa0423fc8738e1b90c2207

commit_message:
Test gate job w/ notifications enabled

I don't really want to enable ceilometer,
but I do want to see if this will detect bug #1805790.

If so, rework things to be able to enable
notifications w/o enabling ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ib4c2a24677d673bc84fa0423fc8738e1b90c2207

Mike, you looked at wrong CI job. We have two parts Compute (Nova) and Storage (Cinder). The last one runs 220 tests:

The first one is Nova part "minimal" sanity check.

What is the "minimal" thrird party CI demands then?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-30 17:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

We do not allow patches for the driver unless the third party is actually running tests that pass on that driver.

Please remove the nova testing against Cinder to avoid future confusion.'}, {'account_id': 12408, 'date': '2017-11-30 18:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I wasn't exact in my previous reply when I said that this job was "wrong". I should have said that it is not the only one.
Other vendors also run different set of tests and it looks like a common practice to have many of them. Am I wrong?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-30 18:17:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

It should be adjusted to the current ploop behavior

I think the name and description of this method is a bit unclear but I realize you didn't introduce it.

That metadata r/o stuff is basically old cruft at this point IMO and I'd rather see it all removed rather than added to.  The initial intent was that Cinder and the Hypervisor would control the r/o management and not set it on the actual backend but certainly it might be valuable to change here like you have.

The biggest objection however for mse is that you've implemented a method in the driver that has no caller.  The question of whether we should have the call in the driver or not aside, there's nowhere that the call is ever sent to the driver."}, {'account_id': 12382, 'date': '2016-08-24 06:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@John Thanks a lot for your review! This patch just implements a set ro/rw method for lvm driver. This method will be called in the BP patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/337580/. SoÔºåwhen the user call the cinder api interface _volume_readonly_update, it will call the backend driver's method "update_readonly_flag" to set ro/rw. Thanks a lot!'}, {'account_id': 20146, 'date': '2016-08-25 02:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
LVM driver support set readonly flag

LVM driver implements the interface update_readonly_flag.
The volume's ro/rw mode will be controlled by lvm volume driver.

Partially-Implements: blueprint support-volume-driver-set-readonly
Change-Id: I8a6a670cc8b49fa95d6bc16073c1bed7faa24981

subject: support volume driver set readonly

@Duncan, Thank you very much for your review. Your said:"Most drivers I can see need this information at initialise_connection time, not as a random driver call". I'm not quite sure I understand what you said. The readonly flag just was controlled by the backend driver. When initialize_connection a volume, it needn't care the flag. user set a volume readonly by two ways: 1.call attach interface by set parameter mode as 'ro'. In this case the readonly was controlled by libvirt. 2.When the user attach the volume to a host manually, run 'readonly-mode-update'CLI command, the readonly flag was set to backend driver.
the volume's ro/rw mode will be controlled by volume driver.
Thanks a lot!'}, {'account_id': 17742, 'date': '2016-07-13 06:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Please at least implement driver level method for LVM (reference driver).  And also note that not all the backend can do 'rw/ro' from backend."}, {'account_id': 12382, 'date': '2016-09-05 03:54:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

@John, Thank you for your review! I agree with you. In view of this modification, it has been implemented an api interface update_readonly_flag. So this patch is just to improve the feature.
Currently, the glance has been implemented config cinder store backend.
So, if create a image, the image will be stored as a volume. Then, the glance will call update_readonly_flag set the volume ro in order to ensure the security of the image data. So if just set ro to volume metadata, it's not be controlled. So, this patch set it to backend driver."}, {'account_id': 12382, 'date': '2016-09-05 06:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 12382, 'date': '2016-09-05 06:30:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

@Gorka, Thanks a lot for your careful review! I will fix it at once for some minor issues. 
In addition, you put forward a question:
"Shouldn't cinder.volume.api.API:attach and cinder.volume.manager.VolumeManager:_clone_image_volume also call this new update_readonly_flag interface when they modify the volume's readonly metadata?"
1.cinder.volume.api.API:attach needn't call update_readonly_flag interface. When call attach interface, the parameter body['os-attach']['mode'] will determine the volume ro/rw mode. If a volume attach to instance, the libvirt will control the volume ro/rw mode. Here just check the metadata and the mode whether or isn't consistent.
2.cinder.volume.manager.VolumeManager:_clone_image_volume, Here need call update_readonly_flag interface. As for here clone a new volume is registered on glance as a image. In order to ensure data security, we should set it.'}, {'account_id': 15831, 'date': '2016-09-08 03:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-05 09:38:55.000000000', 'message': 'support volume driver set readonly

Currently, cinder has a interface set volume readonly. It just set
volume metadata readonly as True or false. But if the user attach
the volume to a host manually, the volume readonly cann't be controled.
So, the BP will implement to set the readonly properties to backend
driver.

The scheme: volume driver provide an interface "update_readonly_flag"
to set the volume ro/rw mode. When the user sets volume readonly as
True or false, the readonly flag will be set to backend driver by the

commit_message:
support volume driver set readonly

Currently, cinder has an interface to set volume readonly flag. It
just sets volume metadata readonly as True or False. But if the user
attach the volume to a host manually, the volume readonly flag isn't
controlled. So, the BP will implement to set the readonly properties
through the backend driver.

The scheme: volume driver provides an interface "update_readonly_flag"
to set the volume ro/rw mode. When the user sets volume readonly as
True or False, the readonly flag will be set to backend driver by the
interface "update_readonly_flag". So, if the volume driver implemented
the interface, the volume's ro/rw mode will be controlled by volume
driver.

Change-Id: I0146ec329f167c45efd2488a271896c003699862
Implements: blueprint support-volume-driver-set-readonly

commit_message:
Cinder: Init LVM volume group for fake_gate driver

This driver uses the LVM volume group like the LVM driver,
so initialize the VG.

Change-Id: I5b095a934322b7b316b301067796dcdcc6c57323

Add fake driver gate test

This can help ensure that tests for features
like consistency groups are functional.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 10:47:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix full backup/restore volume error with rbd backend

When createing or restoring a backup of a large volume with rbd
backend, time-consuming operations like read/write/flush/fsync,
will block eventlet loop and cinder-backup service hangs
until it finished. It makes cinder-backup services unavailable for
a while. So using tpool to execute the time-consuming cmds to avoid
this suitation.

Change-Id: Idab0b64233c847da4b92299f2ec0448bb5abc2a3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix full backup/restore volume error with rbd backend

When createing or restoring a backup of a large volume with rbd
backend, time-consuming operations like read/write/flush/fsync,
will block eventlet loop and cinder-backup service hangs
until it finished. It makes cinder-backup services unavailable for
a while. So using tpool to execute the time-consuming cmds to avoid
this suitation.

Change-Id: Idab0b64233c847da4b92299f2ec0448bb5abc2a3

subject: Experimenting with git review on master branch
messages:
[{'account_id': 29907, 'date': '2019-02-12 00:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-12 00:56:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29907, 'date': '2019-02-25 23:29:21.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

It's just a test, don't merge"}]

commit_message:
use tempest_run_stackviz to generate stackviz report

When os_tempest is used locally or not in CI for
development and testing, it does not make any sense to generate
stackviz report each time. Adding tempest_run_stackviz makes sure
when it is enabled then it will run.

Change-Id: I4f9a6bcce7e1f4b7ebc873ee11f141d40f0d3e36

subject: Fix: cinder group-list not working with non-admin user
messages:
[{'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-26 07:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-26 07:48:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-26 10:15:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-12-26 10:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-02-06 20:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks like a good change.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-02-13 15:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure this change produces the correct behavior.  It's good that it makes "cinder group-list" work, but it also removes the all-tenants arg when running "cinder group-list --all-tenants 0".  Shouldn't that one still add the parameter and fail if the server does not allow that parameter?

Maybe the policy of rejecting "all_tenants=0" on the server side is just incorrect?'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I'm not sure this change produces the correct behavior.  It's good
 > that it makes "cinder group-list" work, but it also removes the
 > all-tenants arg when running "cinder group-list --all-tenants 0". 
 > Shouldn't that one still add the parameter and fail if the server
 > does not allow that parameter?
 > 
 > Maybe the policy of rejecting "all_tenants=0" on the server side is
 > just incorrect?

Hi Eric,
The server doesn't has a specific check for all_tenants with respect to admin and non-admin, it just checks the filters with respect to resources.
If the user is admin, it allows all filters[1], when it's a non-admin it checks it against the resource_filters file [2] [3].
Rejection on server side is a general message and not specific for non-admins requesting all-tenants list.
Also the same approach of building url is followed in other resources (volumes, snapshots, attachments) listing.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/common.py#L410
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/common.py#L420
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/etc/cinder/resource_filters.json'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Removing my +2 as it appears there is more discussion required.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-02-13 19:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-02-15 15:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-02-17 19:19:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-02-17 19:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the review Eric.'}, {'account_id': 6491, 'date': '2019-02-18 02:20:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Fix: cinder group-list not working with non-admin user

The all_tenants filter is passed to API when it's value is 0
(when not specified) which shouldn't be the case.
This patch only allows adding of all_tenants when specified
manually by user.

Change-Id: Ic7810c4d6e9f4be7c28c7a8778d57bb5ccb996a0
Closes-Bug: #1808621
Closes-Bug: #1808622

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-10 12:47:14.000000000', 'message': 'Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I640d5ca592774601a252dbafbdc90bc98313055b
'}]
commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I640d5ca592774601a252dbafbdc90bc98313055b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-05 06:13:29.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup files and templates using smart sources

The files and templates we carry are almost always in a state of
maintenance. The upstream services are maintaining these files and
there's really no reason we need to carry duplicate copies of them. This
change removes all of the files we expect to get from the upstream
service. while the focus of this change is to remove configuration file
maintenance burdens it also allows the role to execute faster.

  * Source installs have the configuration files within the venv at
    "<<VENV_PATH>>/etc/<<SERVICE_NAME>>". The role will now link the
    default configuration path to this directory. When the service is
    upgraded the link will move to the new venv path.
  * Distro installs package all of the required configuration files.

To maintain our current capabilities to override configuration the
role will fetch files from the disk whenever an override is provided and
then push the fetched file back to the target using `config_template`.

Change-Id: I3e7283bf778a9d686f3ae500b289c1fb43b42b92
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-08-05 06:16:04.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup files and templates using smart sources

commit_message:
Cleanup files and templates using smart sources

The files and templates we carry are almost always in a state of
maintenance. The upstream services are maintaining these files and
there's really no reason we need to carry duplicate copies of them. This
change removes all of the files we expect to get from the upstream
service. while the focus of this change is to remove configuration file
maintenance burdens it also allows the role to execute faster.

  * Source installs have the configuration files within the venv at
    "<<VENV_PATH>>/etc/<<SERVICE_NAME>>". The role will now link the
    default configuration path to this directory. When the service is
    upgraded the link will move to the new venv path.
  * Distro installs package all of the required configuration files.

To maintain our current capabilities to override configuration the
role will fetch files from the disk whenever an override is provided and
then push the fetched file back to the target using `config_template`.

Change-Id: I3e7283bf778a9d686f3ae500b289c1fb43b42b92
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 16:30:01.000000000', 'message': "Use placement.inventory.inuse in report client

Since I9a833aa35d474caa35e640bbad6c436a3b16ac5e we've had the framework
for placement to return specific error codes allowing us to
differentiate among error conditions for oft-repeated status codes.
That change also included as its proof-of-concept a specific code for
the placement side of InventoryInUse - i.e. an attempt to delete an
inventory record for which there are existing allocations.

SchedulerReportClient was previously identifying this error condition by
parsing the text of the 409 response.  With this change, it instead uses
the provided error code.

Change-Id: Ic621adcadf10cc607455eba48c4cb1882bde23fa

commit_message:
Use placement.inventory.inuse in report client

Since I9a833aa35d474caa35e640bbad6c436a3b16ac5e we've had the framework
for placement to return specific error codes allowing us to
differentiate among error conditions for oft-repeated status codes.
That change also included as its proof-of-concept a specific code for
the placement side of InventoryInUse - i.e. an attempt to delete an
inventory record for which there are existing allocations.

SchedulerReportClient was previously identifying this error condition by
parsing the text of the 409 response. With this change, it instead uses
the provided error code.

Change-Id: Ic621adcadf10cc607455eba48c4cb1882bde23fa

Prevent race condition in RBD tmeporary directory creation

Prevent race condition in _image_conversion_dir() function RBD.

Change-Id: I295bfc59ad423d8b93950431060fe74f38a7aedb
Closes-Bug: #1652104

commit_message:
Resolve ``ValueError`` when mapping value contains a literal ``=``.

Example ``setup.cfg``::

    project_urls =
      Documentation = https://format-pipfile.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest

Current result::

    $ ./setup.py
    ERROR:root:Error parsing
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/core.py", line 96, in pbr
        attrs = util.cfg_to_args(path, dist.script_args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 258, in cfg_to_args
        kwargs = setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs(config, script_args)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pbr/util.py", line 336, in setup_cfg_to_setup_kwargs
        k, v = i.split(=)
    ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)
    error in setup command: Error parsing /Users/brandon/src/format-pipfile/setup.cfg: ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)

After changes::

    $ ./setup.py egg_info
    [...]
    $ grep -i project-url *.egg-info/PKG-INFO
    [...]
    Project-URL: Documentation, https://format-pipfile.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest
    [...]

add unit tests

    {1} pbr.tests.test_util.TestMapFieldsParsingScenarios.test_project_url_parsing(simple_project_urls) [0.034230s] ... ok
    {1} pbr.tests.test_util.TestMapFieldsParsingScenarios.test_project_url_parsing(query_parameters) [0.029791s] ... ok

Closes-Bug: #1817592
Change-Id: Ifd4c46111528d99dadee77d6aabed201d9e84bdb
Signed-off-by: Brandon LeBlanc <brandon@leblanc.codes>

commit_message:
Karbor providers managed from deployment node

Karbor provider configs can be injected/managed from 'node_custom_config' var

openstack-infra.conf will still be created if no custom providers present

Closes-Bug #1814464

Change-Id: I500daae80596cb7b7342fd8d4affa8f901b24a13

subject: add query parameter in api doc, volume backup list api, add the 'volume_id' parameter in query, filter the backup list result by volume id,the parameter is already working, just add it to the api document

commit_message:
add query parameter in api doc, volume backup list api, add the
'volume_id' parameter in query, filter the backup list result by volume
id,the parameter is already working, just add it to the api document

Change-Id: I345696c5a363b8ff9e8b9c9d3e660b0669f10f33

subject: add query parameter in api doc of volumes backup list

commit_message:
Update test cases

Running 'tox -e py36' causes some test cases to fail. Update test cases
to assert with expected result.

Change-Id: I9028c8bbe0446fbefb8863e250ded66e6c8c6591
Signed-off-by: Kien Ha <kienha9922@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add overbooking quota driver

Add a new quota_driver: OverbookingDbQuotaDriver, that's
largely based on the existing DbQuotaDriver.

The main difference is that it not only checks project quota like
the original driver, but also checks if aggregate usage of projects
within a domain does not exceed domain's quota.

Driver could be enabled by adding this to the cinder.conf:

  quota_driver = cinder.quota.OverbookingDbQuotaDriver

Change-Id: Iaca7fb0311129f5e8316753279caae4cb378af11

commit_message:
Edits to Cinder Block Storage Overview

I find the existing wording in this paragraph is too abstract and could
lead the reader to be confused about what is being stated. For example,
"provides an infrastructure for managing volumes" isn't really clear as
"infrastructure" implies HW when the solution is SW. Therefore, the
objective is to provide additional clarity with the least amount of
additional detail. I also made some gramatical changes (commas before
"and" removed) and made the capitalization more consistent.

Best,

Hagen

Change-Id: If2b73afc754df50be5e5a551354b7f3e0fbe9f5f

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2
Hi Ivan - I've made changes to the test code. Since task tracking happens on a separate thread spawned by the driver, if I get rid of sleep completely, and wait for getTask side-effects to get consumed in a loop, the child thread doesn't get a chance to execute and the main thread times out. Hence I'd to put a sleep interval of 50 milliseconds that allows child thread to complete its processing."}, {'account_id': 26379, 'date': '2017-12-14 17:42:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2
 > Hi Ivan - I've made changes to the test code. Since task tracking
 > happens on a separate thread spawned by the driver, if I get rid of
 > sleep completely, and wait for getTask side-effects to get consumed
 > in a loop, the child thread doesn't get a chance to execute and the
 > main thread times out. Hence I'd to put a sleep interval of 50
 > milliseconds that allows child thread to complete its processing.

The logic now doesn't rely on sleep. Rather it uses thread.join() to ensure child thread completed its execution."}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2017-12-14 18:47:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Build failed.  To recheck use 'infinidat-openstack: recheck'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

Hi Imran, tests still have sleep calls. We can discuss it in IRC, but I don't like such approach at all"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-12-14 20:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I agree with Ivan. There should definitely not be sleeps in unit tests, and any sleeps in the driver code should be mocked out during unit testing to make sure there are not unnecessary delays.'}, {'account_id': 24502, 'date': '2017-12-14 21:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build failed. For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-cinder-driver http://52.35.51.88/85/524185/4/check/dsvm-veritas-hyperscale-cinder-driver/1be90e3 : FAILURE in 39m 45s'}, {'account_id': 26379, 'date': '2017-12-15 04:01:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > I agree with Ivan. There should definitely not be sleeps in unit
 > tests, and any sleeps in the driver code should be mocked out
 > during unit testing to make sure there are not unnecessary delays.

I agree Sean. However, as I explained, if I remove sleep completely from test code, main thread keeps checking if getTask was called on mock object for 'n' number of times and this deprives the worker thread of CPU cycles.
As for sleep in the driver code, sleep duration is configurable as 'hpe3par_poll_unprocessed_tasks_after_time'. For tests, it has been set to 0."}, {'account_id': 26379, 'date': '2017-12-15 07:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26379, 'date': '2017-12-15 07:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Hi Imran, tests still have sleep calls. We can discuss it in IRC,
 > but I don't like such approach at all

Hi Ivan/Sean,
I bypassed the threading part and removed sleep calls from unit tests. However, I'm seeing almost 12-14x performance degradation after this.
Following is the comparison table:
Sleep + Thread:
test_create_cloned_volume    		  0.114273s
test_clone_volume_with_vvs 		      0.120239s 
test_task_tracker_delete_tmp_snapshot 0.115865s

No Sleep No Thread:
test_create_cloned_volume             1.452s
test_clone_volume_with_vvs            1.496s
test_task_tracker_delete_tmp_snapshot 1.459s

I've pushed the changes for your review."}, {'account_id': 26379, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC http://54.209.116.144/85/524185/17/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC/69b49d1 : SUCCESS in 1h 32m 58s'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-01-02 16:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2018-01-02 19:05:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This is a lot of complexity that isn't reliable.   All of this task tracking can be circumvented if Cinder is restarted.   Then you are right back to the same problem of getting temporary snapshots that are very difficult to delete.  

The best solution to this, which I have pointed out a few times now is to stop using online copy.

This patch doesn't really fix anything."}, {'account_id': 22664, 'date': '2018-01-10 03:22:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > This is a lot of complexity that isn't reliable.   All of this task
 > tracking can be circumvented if Cinder is restarted.   Then you are
 > right back to the same problem of getting temporary snapshots that
 > are very difficult to delete.
 > 
 > The best solution to this, which I have pointed out a few times now
 > is to stop using online copy.
Looking at this line of source https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py#L2263 we set the "expirationHours" for temporary hours to 1, meaning these temporary snapshots will be removed by 3PAR system after an hour's time. So, the problem will be only be noticed in rally kind of tests, where the entire tests complete within an hour's time, (or) when they perform parallel cinder create call with --source-vol option. In production environment, this case won't arise whereby lots of temporary snapshots will fill up the entire CPG space. Based on this fact, and also some performance gains for some specific usecases of production customer who are using HPE 3PAR Cinder driver, we would like to keep the online copy in the driver. We don't have any other reason to keep this. And any 3PAR limitation on online copy is being/will be addressed via discussion with 3PAR engineering teams.

This patch will address some usecases around rally tests and parallel $ cinder create with --source-vol with image-vol-cache-enabled=True flag on the cinder.conf
 > 
 > This patch doesn't really fix anything.'}, {'account_id': 24502, 'date': '2018-01-10 12:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 14:03:30.000000000', 'message': '3PAR - Fix temp snapshot that remains post online copy

Issue
=====
For asynchronous tasks such as online copy,
driver creates a temporary snapshot which
remains on the array even after completion of
online copy task. This is highly undesirable as
over a period of time temporary snapshots can
unnecessarily occupy the resources on the array.

Fix
===
For any asynchronous task that is invoked from
driver code on 3PAR using WSAPI, corresponding
task id is returned which is presently not being
used. If the task id and operation context is
saved by the driver and the task is tracked on a
separate thread, any action that is required
post-operation can be performed ‚Äì removal of
temporary snapshot in this case.

Change-Id: I7a6b26be5e9567c82d44b1f0eb3b8340ff15daea
Closes-Bug: #1735053

commit_message:
3PAR - Fix temp snapshot that remains post online copy

Issue
=====
For asynchronous tasks such as online copy,
driver creates a temporary snapshot which
remains on the array even after completion of
online copy task. This is highly undesirable as
over a period of time temporary snapshots can
unnecessarily occupy the resources on the array.

Fix
===
For any asynchronous task that is invoked from
driver code on 3PAR using WSAPI, corresponding
task id is returned which is presently not being
used. If the task id and operation context is
saved by the driver and the task is tracked on a
separate thread, any action that is required
post-operation can be performed ‚Äì removal of
temporary snapshot in this case.

Change-Id: I7a6b26be5e9567c82d44b1f0eb3b8340ff15daea
Closes-Bug: #1735053

So far I tested it like this:

 max_rule_id=$( openstack network qos rule create qp0 --type bandwidth-limit --max-kbps 1000 --egress -f value -c id )

 # no ports using qp0

 # expected to work
 neutron qos-bandwidth-limit-rule-update "$max_rule_id" qp0 --max-kbps 10000 --direction egress
 # expected to work
 neutron qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-update "$min_rule_id" qp0 --min-kbps 1000 --direction egress

 # this port is not in use
 openstack port create port0 --network net0 --qos-policy qp0

 # expected to work
 neutron qos-bandwidth-limit-rule-update "$max_rule_id" qp0 --max-kbps 10000 --direction egress
 # expected to work
 neutron qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-update "$min_rule_id" qp0 --min-kbps 1000 --direction egress
 # expected to work
 tmp_rule_id=$( openstack network qos rule create qp0 --type minimum-bandwidth --min-kbps 1000 --ingress -f value -c id )
 # expected to work
 openstack network qos rule delete qp0 "$tmp_rule_id"

 # this port is in (fake) use
 openstack port create port1 --network net0 --qos-policy qp0 --device-owner compute:fake

 # expected to work
 neutron qos-bandwidth-limit-rule-update "$max_rule_id" qp0 --max-kbps 10000 --direction egress
 # expected to fail
 neutron qos-minimum-bandwidth-rule-update "$min_rule_id" qp0 --min-kbps 1000 --direction egress
 # expected to fail

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 14:38:16.000000000', 'message': 'Reject QoS minimum bandwidth rule updates for bound ports as NotImplemented

Updating QoS rules backed by resources tracked in Placement is a complex
task, which was left out of scope for the Stein release. Of course this
is only relevant for policy rules already in use on bound ports. Rules
of unbound ports can still be updated freely.

commit_message:
Reject QoS minimum bandwidth rule updates for bound ports as NotImplemented

Updating QoS policies and rules backed by resources tracked in Placement
is a complex task, which was left out of scope for the Stein release.
Of course this is only relevant for policies/rules already in use on
bound ports. Rules of unbound ports can still be updated freely.

Please note this patch cannot catch all possible problems. There will
always be a time window between the allocation committed to Placement
and Nova sending the port binding request to Neutron. If the policy or
rule is changed in this window we cannot do anything against it.

APIImpact: Reject QoS minimum bandwidth policy/rule updates for bound
           ports as NotImplemented

Change-Id: I477edb0ae35b385ac776a58195f22382e2fce4ed
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

> I usually question the value of these placeholder folder additions
 > - usually I would rather the folder just be added when there's
 > something of value to be added - but I could see this making it
 > just slightly easier for anyone proposing a goal.

Related:

JP and noticed we don't really have much documentation [0] on the actual process of writing goals. This became apparent in some of our communication with various champions stepping up for goals this cycle when we asked if they'd be willing to get something in review.

I think the existing documentation makes some assumptions that raise the bar for writing a goal.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/#process-details"}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-31 11:51:47.000000000', 'message': 'Multipath tempest scenarios

In order to validate the robustness of the iSCSI multipath code in
OpenStack we require harsher tests than those we have, since they only
test the "happy code path".

This patch adds error injecting tests with validation to confirm there
are no leftovers after an attach or detach failure.

We are testing create volume from image and attaching a volume to an
instance under the following networking error scenarios:

 - No errors
 - All paths have 10% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped

There are single execution versions as well as 10 consecutive operations
variants.

Proposed tests are not in line with the tempest mission since they are
not meant to be run in a production environment due to their disruptive
nature while injecting errors.  They need to be run sequentially and
without any other operations running on the deployment.  They also run
sudo commands via local bash or SSH for the verification and error
generation bits.

Recommended configuration in local.conf for single node devstack is:

  [[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
  [multipath-backend]
  use_multipath_for_image_xfer=true

  [[post-config|$NOVA_CONF]]
  [libvirt]
  volume_use_multipath = True

  [[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]
  [token]
  expiration = 14400

  [[test-config|$TEMPEST_CONFIG]]
  [volume-feature-enabled]
  multipath = True
  [volume]
  build_interval = 10
  multipath_type = $MULTIPATH_VOLUME_TYPE
  backend_protocol_tcp_port = 3260
  multipath_backend_addresses = $STORAGE_BACKEND_IP1,$STORAGE_BACKEND_IP2

And the interesting tests can be run from /opt/stack/tempest with:
  $ OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=7200 ostestr -r 'cinder.tests.tempest.scenario.test_multipath.TestMultipath.test_(create_volumes|attach_detach_many)_with_errors_*' --serial -- -f

Change-Id: Id5188e26a6b52f5d00a6dc8ff52a7e1b0c188345

sudo commands via local bash or SSH for the verification and error
generation bits.

commit_message:
Multipath tempest scenarios

In order to validate the robustness of the iSCSI multipath code in
OpenStack we require harsher tests than those we have, since they only
test the "happy code path".

This patch adds error injecting tests with validation to confirm there
are no leftovers after an attach or detach failure and an appropriate
explanation in the devref documentation.

We are testing create volume from image and attaching a volume to an
instance under the following networking error scenarios:

 - No errors
 - All paths have 10% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - All paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 20% incoming packets dropped
 - Half the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped
 - The other half of the paths have 100% incoming packets dropped

There are single execution versions as well as 10 consecutive operations
variants.

Proposed tests are not in line with the tempest mission since they are
not meant to be run in a production environment due to their disruptive
nature while injecting errors.  They need to be run sequentially and
without any other operations running on the deployment.  They also run
sudo commands via local bash or SSH for the verification and error
generation bits.

Recommended configuration in local.conf for single node devstack is:

  [[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
  [multipath-backend]
  use_multipath_for_image_xfer=true

  [[post-config|$NOVA_CONF]]
  [libvirt]
  volume_use_multipath = True

  [[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]
  [token]
  expiration = 14400

  [[test-config|$TEMPEST_CONFIG]]
  [volume-feature-enabled]
  multipath = True
  [volume]
  build_interval = 10
  multipath_type = $MULTIPATH_VOLUME_TYPE
  backend_protocol_tcp_port = 3260
  multipath_backend_addresses = $STORAGE_BACKEND_IP1,$STORAGE_BACKEND_IP2

And the interesting tests can be run from /opt/stack/tempest with:
  $ OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=7200 ostestr -r 'cinder.tests.tempest.scenario.test_multipath.TestMultipath.test_(create_volumes|attach_detach_many)_with_errors_*' --serial -- -f

Change-Id: Id5188e26a6b52f5d00a6dc8ff52a7e1b0c188345

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 13:32:01.000000000', 'message': 'Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have Bionic
Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with python3.7
in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond. See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: Ia1bc00770fe99f044d492c5dd18349373b8602a4

commit_message:
add python 3.7 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ia1bc00770fe99f044d492c5dd18349373b8602a4
Story: #2004073

Removing that dir before the build should suffice.

commit_message:
Remove docs build before building docs

The docs build can break if there's some stray data from a previous
build, such as if one builds on master, then switches to a stable
branch. Remove the docs build directory before building the docs to
start from a clean state.

Change-Id: Ia2814135ed3c8f98034b0fbb8c24ccaae6ac91df
