[{'account_id': 27759, 'date': '2018-02-07 16:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-07 16:23:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24502, 'date': '2018-02-07 17:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This patch seem to be making some incorrect assumptions on the tests and the mocks and making changes based on those.

There are tests where the mock of the setup method is correct, since the target is only meant to be mocked for that specific call, and any other place where it is required will have its own mocking.  So the change would be doing a double mock.  Example of this are the test_fc_zone_manager.py and test_hgst.py files.

In other places the mock is only needed at the setUp because only calls in there will make the call to the mocked object, so only there is required and the actual tests can be run without the mock, so the mocking is perfect as it is.  An example is the test_scsi.py file.

I haven't seen any case where the change is actually making things better, although I haven't gone one by one, but in general I think this patch is not required, unless we can point to a case where this is actually incorrectly being mocked."}, {'account_id': 21976, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Fix mocks in unit tests

We should not use @mock.patch and @mock.patch.object for setUp methods.
They will be ignored for most cases. This patch adds mocks explicitly
into the setUp methods.

Change-Id: I3a1a3fdbe811d55ab9221d842bedec1c57ee4484

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 21:35:09.000000000', 'message': "Allow current driver to rename temp vol

Prior to this change, volume migration completion only calls the
remote driver's update_migrated_volume() manager method to give that
driver a chance to rename the backend volume (if they are sensitive
to looking up the volume by name property, for example). This is fine
for retype operations where the target volume resides in such a driver.
But if the source volume driver has the same sensitivity, then what
happens for a retype is that the volume properties and metadata get
swapped and the original volume gets deleted, but the delete operation
ends up not doing anything because the volume cannot be found.
The source volume is left orphaned an unmanged on the backend.

This change simply calls the current manager's  update_migrate_volume()
with the volume and new_volume parameters swapped. This allows
analgous backend updates and model data updates to be made for the
original volume, and fixes the existig assymetry in swapping volume
properties, but only updating one of the volumes.

Change-Id: I6098c2a0f1dbcddd6e79a0455ceed13d0da58dd2
Closes-Bug: #1743008
"}]
commit_message:
Allow current driver to rename temp vol

Prior to this change, volume migration completion only calls the
remote driver's update_migrated_volume() manager method to give that
driver a chance to rename the backend volume (if they are sensitive
to looking up the volume by name property, for example). This is fine
for retype operations where the target volume resides in such a driver.
But if the source volume driver has the same sensitivity, then what
happens for a retype is that the volume properties and metadata get
swapped and the original volume gets deleted, but the delete operation
ends up not doing anything because the volume cannot be found.
The source volume is left orphaned an unmanged on the backend.

This change simply calls the current manager's  update_migrate_volume()
with the volume and new_volume parameters swapped. This allows
analgous backend updates and model data updates to be made for the
original volume, and fixes the existig assymetry in swapping volume
properties, but only updating one of the volumes.

Change-Id: I6098c2a0f1dbcddd6e79a0455ceed13d0da58dd2
Closes-Bug: #1743008

messages:
[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-22 21:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-22 22:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-22 22:14:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The doc job assumes if you have redirects set up, you also have tests for those using whereto. There's an existing file, so it just needs to be extended with the new test rules.

https://docs.openstack.org/whereto/latest/ should have instructions, and I'm happy to help if they aren't clear. There is a larger file in the nova repo that might make a good example, too."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-24 21:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-24 21:55:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The doc job assumes if you have redirects set up, you also have
 > tests for those using whereto. There's an existing file, so it just
 > needs to be extended with the new test rules.
 > 
 > https://docs.openstack.org/whereto/latest/ should have
 > instructions, and I'm happy to help if they aren't clear. There is
 > a larger file in the nova repo that might make a good example, too.

They're pretty clear, I just didn't notice whereto test in the the tox environment and was overly focused on the Apache side of things.

I'm a little worried that we can't actually validate this change in the gate as the URLs in the docs job aren't anchored in the root so the patterns don't match.

I guess it isn't a big deal."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-24 22:12:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

 > 
 > I'm a little worried that we can't actually validate this change in

Yeah, I'm not that worried about it. This looks right enough that we can approve it and test it in production. Then when we turn it into a template, as long as we don't change the test rules we'll know we have the template correct when whereto says we do."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-25 21:12:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This matches other places I'm aware of that are doing similar things. Tests seem fine, but safe enough to get this actually merged and validated in production."}]

commit_message:
Add static redirects for constraints

Ultimately we'll do this dynamically but as a POC lets use the existing
.htaccess file[1] to add them statically.  This allows us to test the
end results while we work out how to do this correctly *and* preserve
the current redirect for shade.

[1] This isn't working ATM as until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638527/
    has merged and puppet has been run we don't allow allow any options
    in .htaccess.

Change-Id: I3a7d8f8af3d0f1301cbdbcaa5a46e9eb5672a151

subject: Make test_multiphase_put_drains_extra_commit_junk_disconnect less flakey
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-22 22:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:19:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Do you have any examples of the resulting failures?  Are you sure this fixes the issue?  Normally in a unittest I'd prefer

for i in range(N): sleep(0)

But if waiting 10ms does the trick then this is probably fine."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:49:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Do you have any examples of the resulting failures?

- http://logs.openstack.org/20/570320/19/gate/swift-tox-lower-constraints/a4eca1a/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-22_08_26_22_492120
- http://logs.openstack.org/01/628701/4/check/swift-tox-lower-constraints/44ae420/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-22_21_51_21_377442
- http://logs.openstack.org/01/628701/4/check/swift-tox-py27/4c6b9ba/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-22_22_52_10_885405
- http://logs.openstack.org/01/628701/4/check/swift-tox-py35/34bcd99/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-22_18_44_02_496760

Or, do it locally with something like

 yes test/unit/obj/test_server.py:TestObjectServer.test_multiphase_put_drains_extra_commit_junk_disconnect | head -n 5000 | xargs -L 500 nosetests -q

(The arg limit was necessary or I'd start getting too-many-open-files errors -- presumably there's a leaked fd that we should fix...)

> Are you sure this fixes the issue?

So I started with something like 3x or 5x sleep(0), but I'd still get failures when hammering the test locally. Some non-zero amount of time helped a whole lot. No idea how well it'll work in the gate though :-/

FWIW, we have some precedent for non-zero sleeps; see https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.20.0/test/unit/obj/test_server.py#L7700-L7702 for example."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

well ok then!'}]

commit_message:
Use tox 3.1.1 fixes

By 3.1.1, tox had fixed:
- [1] which mishandled the basepython directive.
- ignoring PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE [2]

Require this version and remove the workarounds.

See ML thread [3] for some details

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/477
[2] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/commit/336f4f6bd8b53223f940fc5cfc43b1bbd78d4699
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/thread.html#132075

Change-Id: I87cbf4b26bdd40a8b7a699966e1ace838a2491de

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 15:55:18.000000000', 'message': "tox: Don't write byte code (maybe)

In tox versions after 3.0.0rc1 [1], setting the environment variable
PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE will cause tox not to write .pyc files, which
means you don't have to delete them, which makes things faster.

In older tox versions, the env var is ignored.

If we bump the minimum tox version to something later than 3.0.0rc1, we
can remove the commands that find and remove .pyc files.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/commit/336f4f6bd8b53223f940fc5cfc43b1bbd78d4699

Change-Id: Id9a97af032a2dbefdc50057270368ad087e6bb5f
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Don't write byte code (maybe)

In tox versions after 3.0.0rc1 [1], setting the environment variable
PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE will cause tox not to write .pyc files, which
means you don't have to delete them, which makes things faster.

In older tox versions, the env var is ignored.

If we bump the minimum tox version to something later than 3.0.0rc1, we
can remove the commands that find and remove .pyc files.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/commit/336f4f6bd8b53223f940fc5cfc43b1bbd78d4699

Change-Id: Id9a97af032a2dbefdc50057270368ad087e6bb5f

commit_message:
Remove the private option from include_role

The private option on include role was never implemented and
will no longer be developed. This change removes the option
so ansible no longer raises a deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I11ca7c3beed3bdabd6fcb517242a41180d1a4e63
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Fix run-tempest role unrecognized arguments error

In case tempest_test_regex variable was set, run-tempest role
was missing "--regex=" argument which resulted in unrecognized
arguments error.

Change-Id: I5f70abdbe5b19a77482ec3ba95522dd92b4f1a9f

subject: Adds check for duplicate alloc_cands
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-24 11:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-24 12:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hmm, trade off between bug fix and performance degradation...'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-24 16:12:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> Hmm, trade off between bug fix and performance degradation...

Where/how are you seeing the performance degradation? Presumably it's only in the tree-/sharing-based code path.

Whatever slowdown you're seeing would have to be because we're now iterating over areqs N^2 times. Implementing __hash__ and using a set instead of a list for areqs ought to bring your 'in' search down to O(1). I did that in [1]. The 'granular' gabbit runs in about the same amount of time; but then I wouldn't expect going from a 9-element list to a 2-element set to make a significant difference. Can you please test it out in whatever env you saw the issue? If it helps, you can squash it in here, or we can leave it separate.

Meanwhile, this fix works, and we can diddle with the performance later if need be, so I'm happy to approve it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638977/"}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-25 02:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-02-25 02:58:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> we're now iterating over areqs N^2 times.

Yeah, that was my concern

> Implementing __hash__ and using a set instead of a list for areqs ought to bring your 'in' search down to O(1).

That is a great idea. Updated."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-25 03:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-25 18:04:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Nice bit of collaboration there to get a tidy solution.

As the NFV uses of placement actually start rolling in, I imagine we're going to find lots of edge cases like this, and rather than fretting about it we simply need to be prepared to fix things as they come up. Which we've done until now, so yay."}]

commit_message:
Adds check for duplicate alloc_cands

This patch adds a check for duplicate allocation candidates in
granular requests scenarios. To check the duplication, the __eq__ and
and the __hash__ operators are added both to AllocationRequestResource
class and to AllocationRequest class.

Change-Id: I8b5b0212077ca930ee69d3f1c349f41433bae68e
Closes-Bug: #1817458

commit_message:
Adds tests for granular single shared rp request

This patch adds a test for granular single shared resource provider
request, which turned out to be broken. Namely, we get duplicate
allocation requests when shared resource is requested alone.

Change-Id: Ia89e011fb51a41db9b7296ab357c36556d7c8fba
Related-Bug: #1817458

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-05 17:22:27.000000000', 'message': "quota: remove QuotaEngine.register_resources()

The QuotaEngine.register_resources() method was not necessary. I've
simply added a resources kwarg to the QuotaEngine constructor and we now
construct the dict of resource objects to initialize the resources the
quota engine cares about.

One more method to the QuotaDriver, gone.

Change-Id: I818bbfb9493714341283042a21d5aefd90c094cb
"}]
commit_message:
quota: remove QuotaEngine.register_resources()

The QuotaEngine.register_resources() method was not necessary. I've
simply added a resources kwarg to the QuotaEngine constructor and we now
construct the dict of resource objects to initialize the resources the
quota engine cares about.

One more method to the QuotaDriver, gone.

Change-Id: I818bbfb9493714341283042a21d5aefd90c094cb

[{'created': '2019-02-20 15:18:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix FC case sensitive scanning

For FC connections there are multiple places where we check the
initiator target map provided by the backend against the port names of
the HBAs on the system.

Currently this check is case sensitive, but some backends are returning
the port names in the initiator target map upper cased, which usually
results in attach failures.

Some of the reasons for the attach failures is that os-brick will not
issue scan requests.

Example from a 3PAR backend from a specific system:

  Connector properties:
    {
     'wwpns': ['10001409dcd71ff6', '10001409dcd71ff7'],
     'wwnns': ['20001409dcd71ff6', '20001409dcd71ff7'],
     ...
    }

  Connection properties:
    {
     'initiator_target_map': {
       '10001409DCD71FF6': ['20320002AC01E166', '21420002AC01E166'],
       '10001409DCD71FF7': ['20410002AC01E166', '21410002AC01E166']
     }
     ...
    }

This patch converts to lower case the
initiator_target_map and the target_wwn/target_wwns.

Closes-Bug: #1775677
Change-Id: I12b9535d8a9969356394e406a1ed5ac4a5f1f959
"}, {'created': '2019-02-21 09:29:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix FC case sensitive scanning

commit_message:
Fix FC case sensitive scanning

For FC connections there are multiple places where we check the
initiator target map provided by the backend against the port names of
the HBAs on the system.

Currently this check is case sensitive, but some backends are returning
the port names in the initiator target map upper cased, which usually
results in attach failures.

Some of the reasons for the attach failures is that os-brick will not
issue scan requests.

Example from a 3PAR backend from a specific system:

  Connector properties:
    {
     'wwpns': ['10001409dcd71ff6', '10001409dcd71ff7'],
     'wwnns': ['20001409dcd71ff6', '20001409dcd71ff7'],
     ...
    }

  Connection properties:
    {
     'initiator_target_map': {
       '10001409DCD71FF6': ['20320002AC01E166', '21420002AC01E166'],
       '10001409DCD71FF7': ['20410002AC01E166', '21410002AC01E166']
     }
     ...
    }

This patch converts to lower case the
initiator_target_map and the target_wwn/target_wwns.

Closes-Bug: #1775677
Change-Id: I12b9535d8a9969356394e406a1ed5ac4a5f1f959

commit_message:
Adding support of glance cinder store settings

Currently TripleO is completely unaware of the 4 glance
settings when cinder backend of glance is enabled.

To make the Image-Volume in the internal project accessible from
the Image service, the below parameters need to be set.

- cinder_store_auth_address
- cinder_store_project_name
- cinder_store_user_name
- cinder_store_password

Conflicts:
      puppet/services/glance-api.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1809104
Change-Id: I15f9c286798b74529a7b4b09d7e9353eb715f5b1
(cherry picked from commit d9a43277e5266e9d25061a4c16f0384529b46da4)
(cherry picked from commit 02298dd074b480399b15da58ca61fa585df17f75)

[{'created': '2019-02-21 08:26:35.000000000', 'message': 'Temporary disable scenarios 1+4 standalone for ceph bluestore

We need to merge [1] +depends on [2] for ceph bluestore support.
The jobs are green once [1] merges but [2] needs to merge first and
it will break both jobs. It is the same other way around i.e. making
[2] depend on [1] they need each other chicken/egg job breaks if
we merge either first.

So make [2] depend on this to disable jobs and we revert after
[1] merges

[1] https://review.openstack.org/547682
[2] https://review.openstack.org/637196

Change-Id: I0b25042d67219d096d9928684fd9deb9a5997d39

commit_message:
Temporary disable scenarios 1+4 standalone for ceph bluestore

We need to merge [1]+[2] for ceph bluestore support. They need each
other but whichever merges first will break the job until the other
merges too. So make [2] depend on this to disable jobs and we revert
after [1] merges

[1] https://review.openstack.org/547682
[2] https://review.openstack.org/637196

Change-Id: I0b25042d67219d096d9928684fd9deb9a5997d39

[{'created': '2019-02-22 20:00:43.000000000', 'message': "Use updated Ubuntu installer kernels on MNAIO

Appears we ran into this bug on 16.04:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debian-installer/+bug/1816876

and the fix is in xenial-updates.  Switching all the ubuntu installer
kernels to the updated ones so that we can make sure we're using
latest and greatest.

Change-Id: I68cccbb142c8b4c657a60929ad21e8164d07a1ef
"}]
commit_message:
Use updated Ubuntu installer kernels on MNAIO

Appears we ran into this bug on 16.04:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/debian-installer/+bug/1816876

and the fix is in xenial-updates.  Switching all the ubuntu installer
kernels to the updated ones so that we can make sure we're using
latest and greatest.

Change-Id: I68cccbb142c8b4c657a60929ad21e8164d07a1ef

commit_message:
Change haproxy mode to http for octavia

We should be using 'http' instead of the configured default of tcp as
the transaction mode for octavia.

Change-Id: Ia23e794009b0c69eb9b24d991fa4ab857a00545f
Closes-Bug: #1815603
(cherry picked from commit ec9766716338f20ee94e43074b2369527ba56cf5)

commit_message:
Change haproxy mode to http for octavia

We should be using 'http' instead of the configured default of tcp as
the transaction mode for octavia.

Change-Id: Ia23e794009b0c69eb9b24d991fa4ab857a00545f
Closes-Bug: #1815603
(cherry picked from commit ec9766716338f20ee94e43074b2369527ba56cf5)

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I70b9cafad10ec5abfc0166feb01c49adbd1f517d

commit_message:
Clean up devstack tempest jobs

- Created new senlin-tempest-base job with devstack-tempest as parent
- Base all senlin tempest jobs on senlin-tempest-base and remove any
  unnecessary settings
- Remove unused playbooks
- Use microversion 1.10 for all tempest jobs

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/635634
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/635621
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/635648

Change-Id: I21998570d0826189a9a019b7cee226560d5388e0

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Ib21fef57404d63579743270be4080d248a4ca8cc

[{'created': '2018-10-15 16:26:09.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Id0d0a55f4ceaa05869cb77abf13ee2fea7bee713

commit_message:
Add python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's add
testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Id0d0a55f4ceaa05869cb77abf13ee2fea7bee713
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I639f87c524ea7f565a8cc6ddaf331afa284b9e22

commit_message:
mention using CIVS for chair election

If there are multiple candidates for chair, using CIVS like we do for
other community elections gives us a way to have private ballots.

Change-Id: Ifcf3e208f9a01fb4d3b84d05b6d6b8964df3b4de
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-10 21:56:12.000000000', 'message': "Force /var/tmp as the test directory for xattr

What we're trying to test here is if the OS even supports xattr
at all. So, it makes sense to use whatever filesystem is most
likely to work. But we don't want to use the current directory
because... no reason. It just seems wrong to pollute a source
diretory with test files. Let's use the root as next bet for
the systems where /tmp is mounted.

Change-Id: I1cdb4edb0b572360295ec2229a952b281a6cd499
"}, {'created': '2016-07-02 19:01:46.000000000', 'message': "Force /var/tmp as the test directory because of xattr

We use xattr a lot. But we don't want to use the current directory
because... no reason. It just seems wrong to pollute a source
diretory with test files. Let's use the root as next bet for
the systems where /tmp is mounted (Fedora 23, for example).

Change-Id: I1cdb4edb0b572360295ec2229a952b281a6cd499
"}]
commit_message:
Force /var/tmp as the test directory because of xattr

We use xattr a lot. But we don't want to use the current directory
because... no reason. It just seems wrong to pollute a source
diretory with test files. Let's use the root as next bet for
the systems where /tmp is mounted (Fedora 23, for example).

Change-Id: I1cdb4edb0b572360295ec2229a952b281a6cd499

commit_message:
clarify the hand-off of chair responsibilities at election

Be a little more explicit about whether the outgoing or incoming chair
is responsible for a block of tasks. Move the liaison assignment task
to the list of tasks after the incoming chair is confirmed.

Change-Id: Ie9f7b5786e73cda2a55c3978b2058dbd39864689
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2016-10-27 05:37:06.000000000', 'message': 'Make TempAuth to pass accesses to outside of /v1

Not sure how this worked previously, but in the current code
GET to /healthcheck returns 401, unless a token is supplied.
In traditional Swift, authentication is not necessary for that.

Also, drop a useless assignment.

Change-Id: Id6e079c8a0f53374dfdce65338f4b82217769ba2

commit_message:
Make TempAuth to pass accesses to outside of /v1

Not sure how this worked previously, but in the current code
GET to /healthcheck returns 401, unless a token is supplied.
In traditional Swift, authentication is not necessary for that.

Also, drop a useless assignment.

Change-Id: Id6e079c8a0f53374dfdce65338f4b82217769ba2

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-31 03:38:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fake GetRing in order to test on systems without Swift

If we run on a box without Swift installed, the probe tests
fails with a panic:

  panic: interface conversion: hummingbird.Daemon is nil, not
  *objectserver.Replicator

This occurs because, although we go to certain lengths to prepare
a fake ring, NewReplicator ends calling GetRing for real.
On a system with Swift installed, it actually loads the rings,
and we promptly override them with our fakes. On a system
without Swift it rolls over, and since we ignore its errors,
we panic.

This patch solves the issue by faking GetRing, so that these
postfactum overrides are not needed anymore. Fortunately we
get to reuse all the hard work that went into faking Ring.

Change-Id: Ib844723c154c65229a9d3db06295e975a04bc5de

This patch solves the issue by faking GetRing, so that these

commit_message:
Fake GetRing in order to test on systems without Swift

If we run on a box without Swift installed, the probe tests
fail with a panic:

  panic: interface conversion: hummingbird.Daemon is nil, not
  *objectserver.Replicator

This occurs because, although we go to certain lengths to prepare
a fake ring, NewReplicator ends calling GetRing for real.
On a system with Swift installed, it actually loads the rings,
and we promptly override them with our fakes. On a system
without Swift it rolls over, and since we ignore its errors,
we panic.

This patch solves the issue by faking GetRing, so that these
postfactum overrides are not needed anymore.

A similar thing is happening in the replicator tests. There,
however, we continue to reassign over our (now faked) Rings[],
because we want to have paremeters passed to faking methods.

Change-Id: Ib844723c154c65229a9d3db06295e975a04bc5de

commit_message:
Patch the policy through proxy operations

Surprisingly, we have a perfectly good support for policies, but
the policies are not passed through proxy, so one cannot actually
access anything stored in a container with non-default policy.

This is a simple patch to recrify this by passing policy
information through proxy.

Change-Id: I994d109552e3c31adac82328577a1e72f20c5bda

commit_message:
Add dist-collect and dist: target

This version does
- Make use of $(HUMMINGBIRD_VERSION) in the Makefile.
- Collect swift's own tarball using a workaround of python setup.py sdist.

See https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/golang-infra-issues-to-solve

Change-Id: I5803d5244aef66a9d50f9f619dee86c898b2e586
Do-Not-Merge: true

This is needed for functional tests that start their own
little object server instead of talking to a pre-existing
cluster. The legacy Swift does this with so-called "in-process"

'}]
commit_message:
Add the -s flag to specify hummingbird.conf

This is needed for functional tests that start their own
little object server instead of talking to a pre-existing
cluster. The legacy Swift does this with so-called "in-process"
functional tests, but it avoids the need for flags by running
the servers straight from test processes and patching the
paths with Python methods.

Change-Id: Id3875adf78523c79e404ac37625efdae2369abb3

Hi Pete,
I think we generally run the object server with stdio closed(-d).
Are you getting the duplicate msg when running
'hummingbird start object -v'? 
I agree we can certainly change log to INFO instead of ERROR if running in console mode."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2017-01-11 08:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Are you getting the duplicate msg when running
 > 'hummingbird start object -v'?

Yes, duplicated. Although the log one is prefixed with "ERROR:" level tag. Having two identical messages looks like an oversight. I found this because I develop things using a local script that starts bin/hummingbird, like legacy .functests would. I didn't want to pollute syslog on my laptop, so -v.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-02-25 19:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

hummingbird died'}]

commit_message:
Improve the "Server started on port 6200" message

When hummingbird object is run with -v, the message is printed
twice. In addition, the log is prefixed with an uppercase
"ERROR" tag, although there's no error.

I think we may safely drop the extra message. Hopefuly your
management scripts do not depend on it.

Change-Id: I49c9d8c329ab9373a24fe9a7757e07ed5307f687

Just had a successful test of the hypothesis that "openstack role add service --user neutron --project service --user-domain Default --project-domain Default" is sufficient to allow Calico to query project name and parent_id fields from the Keystone DB, and this change now includes devstack/plugin.sh doing exactly that.

Look for "project-name" and "project-parent-id" at http://logs.openstack.org/47/635847/3/check/networking-calico-tempest-dsvm/c27339b/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz to see the populated labels.

I've also updated the draft doc at https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/pull/2411 to document this required role config.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-02-19 11:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Generate label with the OpenStack parent project ID for each VM

We previously generated VM endpoint labels indicating the project ID and
project name.  This change adds the parent project ID in the
'projectcalico.org/openstack-project-parent-id' label.

The parent project ID is never included in the Neutron request context,
so unfortunately we can now no longer use that context as a useful
source of project information.  If we haven't cached the information
already, we have to do a Keystone DB lookup.

Change-Id: Iaf7cb7c33c79a0592ea1722a280bc83ca0911fc5

[{'created': '2019-02-23 11:15:43.000000000', 'message': 'Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I422be4bfb6fd6f73f0b24ae9464c5c85689594e1

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I422be4bfb6fd6f73f0b24ae9464c5c85689594e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 14:46:16.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix race condition issue in NetApp driver

This patch fixes the concurrency in the NetApp driver between the
method setup_server and teardown_server by doing the
teardown_server method lock the needed resources correctly.

Closes-bug: #1816640
Change-Id: I7d56384e77b7e18b3c95f182c0a01af82e5fa5a5
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix race condition issue in NetApp driver

This patch fixes the concurrency in the NetApp driver between the
method setup_server and teardown_server by doing the
teardown_server method lock the needed resources correctly.

Closes-bug: #1816640
Change-Id: I7d56384e77b7e18b3c95f182c0a01af82e5fa5a5

to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I841fb0c66a891cc936a117ac2d2fd0b82a60fbd1

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Ie0133b0b05a58ffe86e5474c1150f935ca9f30d2

commit_message:
Include standalone deploy logs for logstash index

Standalone deployment log is not indexed by logstash which
makes impossible to investigate errors related to them.

Change-Id: Ia70bf9850fab5a3b92332b4885e895ed98653596
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add OvnDbInternal to EndpointMap and use it for ovn_db_host

OVN controller/metadata use ovn_dbs_vip hiera key to configure
the central ovn DB. This key is not available on split control
plane or multi cell setup and therefore installation fails.

With this change a new entry gets created in the EndpointMap
named OvnDbInternal. This can then be exported for an overcloud
stack and can be used as an input for the cell stack.

The information from the EndpointMap is used for ovn-metadata
and ovn-controller as the ovn_db_host information in puppet-tripleo

Change-Id: I0d9eb663405d1113ea84e3c12651a3f0dbdfc75d
Closes-Bug: #1817524

commit_message:
Clean up devstack tempest jobs

- Created new senlin-tempest-base job with devstack-tempest as parent
- Base all senlin tempest jobs on senlin-tempest-base and remove any
  unnecessary settings
- Remove unused playbooks
- Use microversion 1.12 for all tempest jobs

Change-Id: I21998570d0826189a9a019b7cee226560d5388e0

commit_message:
Add DISK_GB to compute in SharedStorageFixture

To prepare for tests of the new ?in_tree<N> syntax, this patch adds
DISK_GB inventory to the second compute node provider in the
SharedStorageFixture used in the allocation-candidates gabbits.

Change-Id: I4eb504ad1f0ef8d5caa096460dbd990cc04a8b1f

commit_message:
Replace ansible --sudo with --become in live_migration/hooks scripts

Ansible deprecated --sudo in 1.9 so this change replaces
it with --become.

Change-Id: I40f40766a7b84423c1dcf9d5ed58476b86d61cc4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 18:22:36.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: mark os-cells as deprecated

As part of an effort to scrub the nova docs of cells v1
references [1] this moves the os-cells API reference to
be grouped with the other deprecated APIs.

A section title is added, similar to the "Obsolete APIs"
section, for organizational purposes.

It should be noted that the os-cells APIs have not been
formally deprecated by capping them at some maximum
microversion like the other deprecated proxy APIs or
for the nova-network APIs, but cells v1 was deprecated
in Pike [2] and since the os-cells APIs are admin-only,
they can be considered effectively deprecated with the
cells v1 deprecation itself, and when we delete the
cells v1 service code the APIs will also be gone like
the other Obsolete APIs.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/002569.html
[2] I1a173f7ce0715e684850e030c358e8175fa8724c

Change-Id: I833d2e8d8857448c2922df488ae9d9b425050ddc
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: mark os-cells as deprecated

As part of an effort to scrub the nova docs of cells v1
references [1] this moves the os-cells API reference to
be grouped with the other deprecated APIs.

A section title is added, similar to the "Obsolete APIs"
section, for organizational purposes.

It should be noted that the os-cells APIs have not been
formally deprecated by capping them at some maximum
microversion like the other deprecated proxy APIs or
for the nova-network APIs, but cells v1 was deprecated
in Pike [2] and since the os-cells APIs are admin-only,
they can be considered effectively deprecated with the
cells v1 deprecation itself, and when we delete the
cells v1 service code the APIs will also be gone like
the other Obsolete APIs.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/002569.html
[2] I1a173f7ce0715e684850e030c358e8175fa8724c

Change-Id: I833d2e8d8857448c2922df488ae9d9b425050ddc

[{'created': '2019-01-24 07:09:55.000000000', 'message': "Handle unicode multi-byte characters

If you pass unicode multi-byte character to 'hypervisor-list'
and 'instance-usage-audit-log' commands using --matching
and --before options respectively, it returns keyerror.

This patch fixes these issues by encoding the host name and
date passed to the --matching and --before options
respectively.

Closes-Bug: #1804156

Change-Id: I9587af7e0fdd921fcaebe3e5c6c5bb40a9393e01
"}, {'created': '2019-02-22 06:02:40.000000000', 'message': "Handle unicode multi-byte characters

If you pass unicode multi-byte character to 'hypervisor-list'
and 'instance-usage-audit-log' commands using --matching
and --before options respectively, it returns keyerror.

This patch fixes these issues by encoding the host name and
date passed to the --matching and --before options
respectively.

Closes-Bug: #1804156

Change-Id: I9587af7e0fdd921fcaebe3e5c6c5bb40a9393e01
"}]
commit_message:
Handle unicode multi-byte characters

If you pass unicode multi-byte character to 'hypervisor-list'
and 'instance-usage-audit-log' commands using --matching
and --before options respectively, it returns keyerror.

This patch fixes these issues by encoding the host name and
date passed to the --matching and --before options
respectively.

Closes-Bug: #1804156

Change-Id: I9587af7e0fdd921fcaebe3e5c6c5bb40a9393e01

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I041af9f00d9463e35a53d1979cf03697cdf41376

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I6a42a790a327334616f9af706a15494838e92523

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: I511f23ac6af3b46bb6f0afc68b41fa1715ba9146

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 23:04:33.000000000', 'message': "Add cron job for Gnocchi to purge deleted resources

The current gnocchi chart doesn't purge the resources/metrics for
the deleted openstack resources. This commit adds a cron job to
periodically purge the deleted resources data from gnocchi database.
By default, cron job runs daily and purges the deleted resources with
its associcated metrics which have lived more that 1 day.

Change-Id: Id45b92b91bb7668b35c3b5a7379283de51a1256a
Story: 2005016
Task: 29494
Signed-off-by: Angie Wang <angie.wang@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Add cron job for Gnocchi to purge deleted resources

The current gnocchi chart doesn't purge the resources/metrics for
the deleted openstack resources. This commit adds a cron job to
periodically purge the deleted resources data from gnocchi database.
By default, cron job runs daily and purges the deleted resources with
its associcated metrics which have lived more that 1 day.

Change-Id: Id45b92b91bb7668b35c3b5a7379283de51a1256a
Story: 2005016
Task: 29494
Signed-off-by: Angie Wang <angie.wang@windriver.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-21 16:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-21 17:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

lgtm, thanks'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-21 21:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23922, 'date': '2019-02-21 23:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-02-22 00:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I would add that this issue could cause problems as:

frame_header timeout
And/or
rabbitmq missed heartbeats from client timeout 60s

RabbitMQ server side logs'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-02-22 14:05:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

The rabbit telemetry integration test is busted.  This patch won't merge until the backport of Andy's fix lands:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638663/"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-22 20:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck the failing test is now non-voting.'}, {'account_id': 19307, 'date': '2019-02-22 21:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Allow lists to be generated from any non-string iterable

The type check on the list field requires a list, though many
objects can be trivially iterated as lists, like sqlalchemy
lazy query objects. Relax the check slightly to fit a broader
range of "lists".

Change-Id: I514a0e6d445e9a14e3c0279b4e9bebfa0940337d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 03:31:36.000000000', 'message': "Revise driver api for introspection data backend

The patch revises driver interface for the introspection data
backends. Previously getting introspection data supports node
uuid/name, while saving takes a node_info object, which is not
consistent and makes migration tool looks weird if implemented
based upon it.

For the get() interface, actually only uuid will be passed in,
so it's narrowed down to accept only uuids, logic names will be
converted from api level if there is a need.

The save() interface is changed to accept node uuid instead of
node_info, which is consistent with the get() interface.

Change-Id: I4702ed7372d0e60ed6252879a7496649a0453b84
Story: 1726713
Task: 11373
"}]
commit_message:
Revise driver api for introspection data backend

The patch revises driver interface for the introspection data
backends. Previously getting introspection data supports node
uuid/name, while saving takes a node_info object, which is not
consistent and makes migration tool looks weird if implemented
based upon it.

For the get() interface, actually only uuid will be passed in,
so it's narrowed down to accept only uuids, logic names will be
converted from api level if there is a need.

The save() interface is changed to accept node uuid instead of
node_info, which is consistent with the get() interface.

Change-Id: I4702ed7372d0e60ed6252879a7496649a0453b84
Story: 1726713
Task: 11373

commit_message:
Use validate_legacy

This changes all the puppet 3 validate_* functions
to use the validate_legacy function.

The validate_legacy function has been available since
about three years but require Puppet >= 4.4.0 and since
there is Puppet 4.10.12 as latest we should assume people
are running a fairly new Puppet 4 version.

This is the first step to then remove all validate function
calls and use proper types for parameter as described in spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568929/

Change-Id: Ib6f668fed59f8285edafa67f12135fc5032e8f72

commit_message:
Revert "Fail to live migration if instance has a NUMA topology"

This reverts commit ae2e5650d14a2c81dd397727d67b60f9b8dd0dd7.

Now that we have NUMA live migration support, we can revert this
workaround.

Conflicts:
In nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py because 3730bd0791
In nova/conf/workarounds.py because d6c1f6a103

Change-Id: I8972574b3ab24b23986b21606ac06135ad224b2a

'}, {'created': '2019-02-05 02:46:19.000000000', 'message': "Rename test-requirements to avoid being picked by devstack

- Our test-requirements.txt has other neutron subprojects like
  neutron-fwaas for unit tests.
- Our devstack plugin uses pip_install to install ourselves.
- pip_install unconditionally installs requirements from
  test-requirements.

As a consequence, during a devstack run we installs neutron-fwaas
etc unconditionally. It isn't desirable because:

- We don't want to install neutron-fwaas etc for our non -full jobs.

- The version in test-requirements.txt might be inappropriate for
  what we want to install for devstack based jobs.

To workaround the issue, this commit renames test-requirements.txt
to avoid being picked by pip_install.

tox-test-requirements.txt and doc/requirements.txt are identical
(actually a symlink) for now. We can separate and slim them down
a bit later if desirable.

An alternative is to stop using pip_install. But it might be more
complex than this commit given the amount of code it has.

commit_message:
Rename test-requirements to avoid being picked by devstack

- Our test-requirements.txt has other neutron subprojects like
  neutron-fwaas for unit tests.
- Our devstack plugin uses pip_install to install ourselves.
- pip_install unconditionally installs requirements from
  test-requirements.

As a consequence, during a devstack run we installs neutron-fwaas
etc unconditionally. It isn't desirable because:

- We don't want to install neutron-fwaas etc for our non -full jobs.
  (Consider DB migration scripts, tempest plugins, etc.)
- The version in test-requirements.txt might be inappropriate for
  what we want to install for devstack based jobs.

To workaround the issue, this commit renames test-requirements.txt
to avoid being picked by pip_install.

tox-test-requirements.txt and doc/requirements.txt are identical
(actually a symlink) for now. We can separate and slim them down
a bit later if desirable.

An alternative is to stop using pip_install. But it might be more
complex than this commit given the amount of code it has.

Closes-Bug: #1814615
Change-Id: I52de37ee7a00e6a808cf1e33b4fdb1b3e462fa0b

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and octavia use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json moudule to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=jsonutils&type=

Change-Id: I1cf966595bbabd3e33b1e33033dfb6a8b16381f8

commit_message:
Refactor "networks" processing in ServersController.create

In an effort to try and de-clutter the create() method this
change refactors the code that processes the "networks"
request parameter to a separate method.

Change-Id: I419336ea845bdd11d02ba098d8a6521a730906fd

commit_message:
flatten gnocchi services config

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files
into a single file that performs the docker service installation
and configuration.

[{'account_id': 330, 'date': '2019-02-20 22:27:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2019-02-20 22:50:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-02-21 17:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-21 17:25:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

Correct, ocata don't accept new tags."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2019-02-21 22:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

so much for extended maintenance then?'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2019-02-21 22:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-21 23:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> so much for extended maintenance then?

[Off topic]
I rediscovered recently that EM means "No Releases produced, reduced CI commitment." [1]
I thought it was allowing tagging on a "best effort" basis, but I was wrong.
I guess it means we will pile up patches in those branches with no guarantee for users. If we pile up patches with no CI guarantee, I understand why it would be better to not tag.
I know I am not good with words, but "extended maintenance" means something else in my brain than "no releases" and "reduced commitments". I wonder if we should rename that to confuse people less... Opinion?

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#maintenance-phases
[/off topic]'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-22 00:45:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-22 16:23:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

These look good. I'll leave it open until Monday to give the stable team a chance to review it."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-02-25 05:55:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me

Not +W as I'm not around to watch the release pipeline"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-25 08:13:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-25 15:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Silence! A sequel

Turns out there's *even more* stuff bleeting in the logs:

  [openstackdocstheme] other_versions []

Silence these for the same reasons given in change
I2123f029b0e49f51ebe6c703354e8063fa6e690a.

Change-Id: I2123f029b0e49f51ebe6c703354e8063fa6e690a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow to use _max qos option together with per_gb

With this patch it'll become possible to limit max performance of volume
even when qos is set per_gb. As a result operator will be able to set
min and max options, with per gb increment, until the max value.

Change-Id: I3c6c9e1c50100cfa56dcadf6445729484cdd616d

commit_message:
Remove team fragility stats script

We no longer provide governance tags focused on team "fragility" so
the team_fragility.py is fairly irrelevant for us now and its
presence in this repository may be sending the wrong message. It
also relies on Stackalytics which, at the time of writing, is not
open source.

Change-Id: I842e186f113727badfecff78eb37f74c225c1a22

commit_message:
remove use of brctl from vif_plug_linux_bridge

- This change replaces calls to brctl with calls
  to the ip_command interface.
- This change adds a release note for the brctl
  removal.
- This change removes the use of tee to disable
  ipv6 in the linux bridge plugin.

Change-Id: Id03be72e22302a0954f3e47c116f389cb4304c03
Closes-Bug: #1801919

commit_message:
placement: Separate deployment from configuration

To allow for the deprecation and future removal of any Placement service
deployment logic from puppet-nova this code first needs to be separated
into its own class.

Change-Id: Iadc2970afb65a6b3a1a3241147d042e6b04b0ad2

This appears to switch the job, without retaining a python 2 version. Do you have these tests running in some other way under python 2? We're not supposed to drop python 2 support until the U cycle."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-16 20:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-20 19:10:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This appears to switch the job, without retaining a python 2
 > version. Do you have these tests running in some other way under
 > python 2? We're not supposed to drop python 2 support until the U
 > cycle.

If we have python2 unit tests running, what value really is a python2  full integration test? I'm not sure I really see value, but I see duplicating expensive jobs as increasing the cost for CI. I think switching the primary focus of a singular integration test job doesn't equate to dropping python2 support, at least in my brain."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-20 19:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-01-21 14:00:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I'd like the zuul v3 migration to happen first, but this is fine with me as well."}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2019-01-22 10:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-25 14:21:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Switch sushy-tools devstack job to python3

Makes a copy of the job, and explicitly sets it to be
python2.

Change-Id: I6c31d8b7e52cddb46c56189d177d7f05449b95c4

commit_message:
Rebuild to handle Mimic pool tagging requirements

In Mimic, CephFS requires that the backing pools
have application tags of "cephfs" explicitly, and will
fail to configure on other application pools

Change-Id: Iffe4b6edb8b7ab33bfde77f2e8bf12ae8bffac1a

commit_message:
baremetal: install docker-ce/upstream on Debian/Ubuntu

Upstream provides 'docker-ce' package for both amd64 and arm64 nowadays.
So let's use them instead of old Linaro one.

Change-Id: Id9a6c4c85eeb62d5215abb9d7e9149299d484f0c

commit_message:
[FFU] Make sure group access work correctly with ansible 2.6.

Hi, with ansible 2.6 we cannot access the groups variable using the
previous idiom anymore.  Use a more robust way to access that
variable.

Co-Authored-By: "Lukas Bezdicka <lbezdick@redhat.com>"
Change-Id: I26f97e7fc4da0dd19e1e8a19b3f6a1c1160f7466
Closes-bug: #1816422
(cherry picked from commit a0c3612db836343143b8ebd160710216203dfc8a)

commit_message:
[FFU] Make sure group access work correctly with ansible 2.6.

Hi, with ansible 2.6 we cannot access the groups variable using the
previous idiom anymore.  Use a more robust way to access that
variable.

Co-Authored-By: "Lukas Bezdicka <lbezdick@redhat.com>"
Change-Id: I26f97e7fc4da0dd19e1e8a19b3f6a1c1160f7466
Closes-bug: #1816422
(cherry picked from commit a0c3612db836343143b8ebd160710216203dfc8a)

commit_message:
Add normalize_name utility

The normalize_name utility provides consumers of os-resource-classes
with a way of generating a known-good name for a custom resource class.
This is equivalent to the os-traits utility of the same name [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-traits/blob/9eab06df2f7528d9cc2cdb5ade69ea9d27ceeb99/os_traits/__init__.py#L113

Change-Id: Id5557d65f11ed4dee10c8df2a42a4c485bfd65d1

This is an emergencial workaround.
Barbican and octavia tempest plugins are using same config, so

commit_message:
Send return of tempest init to /dev/null

This is an emergencial workaround.
Barbican and octavia tempest plugins are using same config, so
oslo is complaining about duplicate barbican option.
Since we are running this in a containerized tempest image, with all
rpms installed, there's no way right now to remove the package.

Change-Id: I3ac5ae0a0ec3bec9cc6b724416833451014ded19
Related-Bug: 1817154

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I27308a2435a4dca572d736f56a02b0bbc8563981

subject: Adding DuplicateOptError exception on register_opts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2019-02-25 10:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-02-25 10:33:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Shouldn't this be fixed in the octavia plugin instead? They may have crossed a line."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-02-25 12:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with tosky. none of the repo/plugins should register the duplicate config option. 

There are many tempest-plugin like congress etc which need to check some other plugin service_availability. So they check the service presence in their devstack plugin and then set the service_availability of that service in tempest.conf. Note, they only set the value of that config option but do not register. registry of config options has to be done in own plugin only. 

What Octavia can do here is, check the presence of CONF.service_available.barbican and if that config option is not registered/available then, consider that Barbican is not available and skip the test/operation. For example[1].

Setting of value can be handled via devstack plugin as service_available.barbican is default to false in barbican-tempest-plugin [2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/congress-tempest-plugin/blob/4390716a373b67a85fadc743495494bd18679b63/congress_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/congress_datasources/test_mistral.py#L31

[2] https://github.com/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/blob/123dd7d4162c39a1cb4b4c1b09a5dceaee127eb6/barbican_tempest_plugin/config.py#L19'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2019-02-25 13:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

in favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639083'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 10:18:01.000000000', 'message': "Adding DuplicateOptError exception on register_opts

This is just to warn the user that there's a duplicated option.
Usually, this happen when you have two tempest plugin installed on your
system and both are trying to configure the same option.
As an example happening right now, the change
I7013888f94261d94e1cd4c3167dc84da7125d1da added on octavia tempest
plugin a verification if barbican is enabled or not, if not, it set the
service avialbility to barbican to false, and on barbican when
register_opts is called, it fails because the service_available.barbican
was already configured to False.

Change-Id: I4cccab542b3ee3e1fe4d1751665541c850427be6
Closes-Bug: 1817154
"}]
commit_message:
Adding DuplicateOptError exception on register_opts

This is just to warn the user that there's a duplicated option.
Usually, this happen when you have two tempest plugin installed on your
system and both are trying to configure the same option.
As an example happening right now, the change
I7013888f94261d94e1cd4c3167dc84da7125d1da added on octavia tempest
plugin a verification if barbican is enabled or not, if not, it set the
service avialbility to barbican to false, and on barbican when
register_opts is called, it fails because the service_available.barbican
was already configured to False.

Change-Id: I4cccab542b3ee3e1fe4d1751665541c850427be6
Closes-Bug: 1817154

commit_message:
remove brctl from vif_plug_ovs

- This change extends the ip_command interface set function
  to accept a master as a parent device for a given interface.
- This change extends the impl_pyroute2 add function to
  support creating linux bridges.
- This change replaces calls to brctl with calls to the ip_command api.
- This change removes the use of tee to disable ipv6 in the ovs plugin.

Change-Id: I8308e8840e20b0a72d00880c1a7996b4c73f6a83
Partial-Bug: #1801919

[{'created': '2019-02-13 12:05:44.000000000', 'message': 'vnffg-create failed abnormally due to invalid network_src_port_id

When create a vnffg with a non-existent network_src_port_id in vnffgd,
create command failed abnormally with "internal server error".
This patch will handle the issue and raise FlowClassifierPortNotFound
exception.

commit_message:
vnffg-create failed abnormally due to invalid network_src_port_id

When create a vnffg with a non-existent network_src_port_id in vnffgd,
create command failed abnormally with "internal server error".
This patch will handle the issue and raise FlowClassifierPortNotFound
exception.

Partially Implements: blueprint improve-return-message
Closes-bug: #1710633

Change-Id: If9c36cb260d43bec515a52b93e10f714d063dc92

commit_message:
[prometheus] Enable ceph mgr exporter

This patch enables the ceph mgr prometheus exporter.

If enable_prometheus_ceph_mgr_exporter is set to true,
the ceph mgr prometheus plugin is enabled on the hosts that are part
of the ceph-mgr group, then the exporter is added into the prometheus-server
configuration file.

Change-Id: Ia2f879401e585e6043f69cc5e3ab1a1f72f7f033
(cherry picked from commit 9d2770db1107c7c32f278eb150ac01e1985df5cf)

commit_message:
Remove sandbox-related logic

The 'sandbox' code path in compute manager and driver is only
used to create/delete capsule. After the consolidation of
capsule and container code [1][2], the sandbox logic is not
used anymore. This commit removes these unused code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/636070/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633371/

Change-Id: Ib8d2dff699a816686be4b1a53bf1463ffce02cdf

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 10:14:48.000000000', 'message': "Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached volumes
in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the destination
node. This means that after migration completes the BDM no longer has a
reference to the original connection_info to do the detach on the source
host. To address this, change I3dfb75eb added a second call to
initialize_connection on the source host to re-fetch the source host
connection_info before calling disconnect.

Unfortunately the cinder driver interface does not strictly require that
multiple calls to initialize_connection will return consistent results.
Although they normally do in practice, there is at least one cinder
driver (delliscsi) which doesn't. This results in a failure to
disconnect on the source host post migration.

This change avoids the issue entirely by fetching the BDMs prior to
modification on the destination node. As well as working round this
specific issue, it also avoids a redundant cinder call in all cases.

Note that this massively simplifies post_live_migration in the libvirt
driver. The complexity removed was concerned with reconstructing the
original connection_info. This required considering the cinder v2 and v3
use cases, and reconstructing the multipath_id which was written to
connection_info by the libvirt fibrechannel volume connector on
connection. These things are not necessary when we just use the original
data unmodified.

Other drivers affected are Xenapi and HyperV. Xenapi doesn't touch
volumes in post_live_migration, so is unaffected. HyperV did not
previously account for differences in connection_info between source and
destination, so was likely previously broken. This change should fix it.

NOTE(lyarwood): conflict due to Ibb8c12fb2799bb5ceb9e3d72a2b86dbb4f14451e
not being present in stable/rocky.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Closes-Bug: #1754716
Closes-Bug: #1814245
Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5
(cherry picked from commit b626c0dc7b113365002e743e6de2aeb40121fc81)

commit_message:
Avoid redundant initialize_connection on source post live migration

During live migration we update bdm.connection_info for attached volumes
in pre_live_migration to reflect the new connection on the destination
node. This means that after migration completes the BDM no longer has a
reference to the original connection_info to do the detach on the source
host. To address this, change I3dfb75eb added a second call to
initialize_connection on the source host to re-fetch the source host
connection_info before calling disconnect.

Unfortunately the cinder driver interface does not strictly require that
multiple calls to initialize_connection will return consistent results.
Although they normally do in practice, there is at least one cinder
driver (delliscsi) which doesn't. This results in a failure to
disconnect on the source host post migration.

This change avoids the issue entirely by fetching the BDMs prior to
modification on the destination node. As well as working round this
specific issue, it also avoids a redundant cinder call in all cases.

Note that this massively simplifies post_live_migration in the libvirt
driver. The complexity removed was concerned with reconstructing the
original connection_info. This required considering the cinder v2 and v3
use cases, and reconstructing the multipath_id which was written to
connection_info by the libvirt fibrechannel volume connector on
connection. These things are not necessary when we just use the original
data unmodified.

Other drivers affected are Xenapi and HyperV. Xenapi doesn't touch
volumes in post_live_migration, so is unaffected. HyperV did not
previously account for differences in connection_info between source and
destination, so was likely previously broken. This change should fix it.

NOTE(lyarwood): conflict due to Ibb8c12fb2799bb5ceb9e3d72a2b86dbb4f14451e
not being present in stable/rocky.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Closes-Bug: #1754716
Closes-Bug: #1814245
Change-Id: I0390c9ff51f49b063f736ca6ef868a4fa782ede5
(cherry picked from commit b626c0dc7b113365002e743e6de2aeb40121fc81)

commit_message:
Initial commit of the SBI revision system

This patch implements the basic API for the SBI revision system, as
defined by the neutron spec [1].

[1]:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/sbi-database-consistency

Change-Id: I58cc11d8451fe586bad5c83274144f83ee420e6a
Implements: blueprint sbi-database-consistency

commit_message:
Tell people how to ignore their personnal editor temporary files

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/592520/ editor temporary files
aren't ignore anymore. This comment tells how to do that in order to
avoid future people coming around and wanting to add editor related
rules in the .gitignore file.

Change-Id: I47b7ebf7c8afe22c4bd7643c855940649f6da52c

and the mixin will be removed before long.

than those of the mixin.

Change-Id: I767b88d3a70d744e4170325a9f2c2dc36163756b
"}, {'created': '2019-02-11 14:56:21.000000000', 'message': "stop using common db mixin

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather

classes.

Change-Id: I767b88d3a70d744e4170325a9f2c2dc36163756b

commit_message:
stop using common db mixin

All of the methods of common db mixin are available via neutron-lib
and the mixin will be removed before long.
This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's APIs rather
than those of the mixin and stops using common_db_mix for parent
classes.

Change-Id: I767b88d3a70d744e4170325a9f2c2dc36163756b

@David, thanks for fixing this bug. The storops version 0.1.* is very old. From 0.2.0, remove_hba is renamed to delete_hba. And in recent Cinder release, we put the required version of storops in driver-requirements.txt. It is all greater than version 0.1.*, which means version 0.1.* is barely used. commit_message:
VNX Driver: delete_hba() instead of remove_hba()

The storops drivers doesn't have a remove_hba() function,
it's called delete_hba(). The confusion comes from the fact
that storops uses -removeHBA argument when calling
naviseccli.

Change-Id: I3f72481442436ddf78c10ab53c161663b05a330a
Closes-bug: #1813525

commit_message:
Add Zun scenario job for ubuntu

Introduce a job 'kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source-zun' to test kolla
with Zun enabled. To reduce CI resource, this job will be triggered
only if there are changes on the Zun's ansible roles.

Change-Id: I0ba207e1d3761da2d6992c5834d4f59e7e1d6628
(cherry picked from commit f57c1aec6cafd0f2b4d6c04c787745b9f2729604)
(cherry picked from commit a1ce8af398c144dc8e1e621e565fd46abb717c43)

commit_message:
gnocchi rpm naming cleanup

During the Queens cycle the gnocci project was
moved out of openstack and so naming changed from
openstack-gnocchi-XXX to gnocchi-XXX

January 2018 - https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11110/

Also openstack-gnocchi-indexer-sqlalchemy was moved to gnocchi-common

2017 - https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/10449/

Change-Id: I511c248bd009d03cad6811c576dd91a7bb29e203

Uhm, overriding SAHARA_ENABLE_PLUGINS makes sure that the plugins are not cloned and zuul is happy, but that also means that the list of configured plugins matches the list of plugins installed, and the patch is not tested. Not sure how to change this properly. Maybe have two different variables in the devstack plugin, one which ends up into sahara.conf as DEFAULT.plugins (the current SAHARA_ENABLED_PLUGINS) and the other which drives the list of installed plugins? (SAHARA_INSTALLED_PLUGINS?)'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2019-01-21 13:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2019-01-21 16:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This is not necessary anymore. This is working already.'}]

commit_message:
Lots Of Small Files - alternate diskfile

The "LOSF" patch provides swift with an efficient way of storing small
files. The files (objects, if using replication, or fragments if using
erasure coding) are stored in larger files.
They are indexed in a key/value store.

Change-Id: I45b088b621b958bdd66ea9ab80b818482a305c63

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 17:34:26.000000000', 'message': 'Include .inc files in doc8 linting

We use *.inc files extensively, especially in the api-ref, but these
files are not covered by default with our doc8 validation.

This adds support for those files and fixes a few issues that were
identified after enabling coverage.

Change-Id: I807823f3cb44274c3940db55e901d434304a09f5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Include .inc files in doc8 linting

We use *.inc files extensively, especially in the api-ref, but these
files are not covered by default with our doc8 validation.

This adds support for those files and fixes a few issues that were
identified after enabling coverage.

Change-Id: I807823f3cb44274c3940db55e901d434304a09f5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Use overlay2 in tools/setup_Redhat.sh
messages: [{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-02-22 18:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23942, 'date': '2019-02-24 19:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 18:51:16.000000000', 'message': 'Use overlay2 in tools/setup_Redhat.sh

Currently CentOS gates use btrfs storage driver and
create /docker device backing btrfs.

This patch is to sync the gate run with Ubuntu.
(post-Trusty) does not use btrfs, only overlay2.

Change-Id: Ic5caa8cf0271b21f71f03fd33c35b3c7bc93ccf4
(cherry picked from commit c50df69045e361a3d1136471b147854684ab1e31)
'}]
commit_message:
Use overlay2 in tools/setup_Redhat.sh

Currently CentOS gates use btrfs storage driver and
create /docker device backing btrfs.

This patch is to sync the gate run with Ubuntu.
(post-Trusty) does not use btrfs, only overlay2.

Change-Id: Ic5caa8cf0271b21f71f03fd33c35b3c7bc93ccf4
(cherry picked from commit c50df69045e361a3d1136471b147854684ab1e31)

subject: Change some repos from xenial to bionic
messages: [{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-02-22 19:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-02-25 07:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 19:01:19.000000000', 'message': 'Change some repos from xenial to bionic

At the time of bumping Ubuntu images to bionic, some repos did not have
bionic versions - so xenial repos were used.
Most of the repos - apart odl now have a bionic tree - so this patch
enables them.

Change-Id: Id3c67fad507adc7b9f200eced74ecba8fadf70e6
'}]
commit_message:
Change some repos from xenial to bionic

At the time of bumping Ubuntu images to bionic, some repos did not have
bionic versions - so xenial repos were used.
Most of the repos - apart odl now have a bionic tree - so this patch
enables them.

Change-Id: Id3c67fad507adc7b9f200eced74ecba8fadf70e6

messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-02-22 10:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-02-22 11:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\ncharm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-02-25 10:07:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 10:37:49.000000000', 'message': 'Release based management of haproxy context

Ensure that the haproxy context reflects the services associated
with the specific release of OpenStack being deployment.

    < kilo: ec2 and s3 services deployed
    >= ocata: placement service deployed

Change-Id: I0d44aa361595f777df625d3a4a0f2a0cd2f81660
Closes-Bug: 1811398
'}]
commit_message:
Release based management of haproxy context

Ensure that the haproxy context reflects the services associated
with the specific release of OpenStack being deployment.

    < kilo: ec2 and s3 services deployed
    >= ocata: placement service deployed

Change-Id: I0d44aa361595f777df625d3a4a0f2a0cd2f81660
Closes-Bug: 1811398

messages: [{'account_id': 25277, 'date': '2019-02-22 11:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-02-22 13:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-02-25 09:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 11:59:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix location of hostdirs for Murano services

Use "{{ node_config_directory }}/murano-api/" for `murano-api` and
"{{ node_config_directory }}/murano-engine/" for `murano-engine`, so
correct `config.json` are mounted in containers.

Change-Id: I824ff00f6b86aac3eab5dc6fd01728653b4661d1
Closes-Bug: 1811716
'}]
commit_message:
Fix location of hostdirs for Murano services

Use "{{ node_config_directory }}/murano-api/" for `murano-api` and
"{{ node_config_directory }}/murano-engine/" for `murano-engine`, so
correct `config.json` are mounted in containers.

Change-Id: I824ff00f6b86aac3eab5dc6fd01728653b4661d1
Closes-Bug: 1811716
